fsjwuLH0SdRNbiJeuEudSg.text: Cool happy hour vibe. Gets really busy so come early or have patience with good friends or family. Taco tour is a can't miss. Get the carne asada or pollo. Wash it down with a decent selection of cervezas on tap.

CFlQ54UGFaDpWEv5B5iGYg.text: My BF and I come here a lot as they have vegan food and are happy to accommodate my picky needs. Chuck and Fire behind the bar are always friendly and pour a tasty drink!

g0CdEFuPLFkBlklvrbGLgw.text: We visited Sir Veza's for the first time and were attracted to it by the fun music and atmosphere! The food was amazing and our waiter Matthew was so kind and helpful. He recommended he Diablo shrimp tacos and they were amazing. Prices were reasonable too. Highly recommend this place and will be back!

ShwOOJo5X2DEaNT3BKVaFg.text: If you enjoy being taken for an idiot and eating mediocre food in a nice atmosphere with cool music, this is the place to go.  First, the restaurant is very charming with its old garage like style, and they play good music (Smashing Pumpkins made the lunch more pleasant). That, unfortunately, is almost the only positive thing I can say.  We ordered a Coke and an iced tea, and we got - a diet coke. We notified the waitress and she brought a new one and explained in detail how the soda machine doesn't really work at the moment. No problem, but the explanation did not make much sense to us. Admit that it was a mistake, say sorry, and everything would be okay. We got some chips and salsa for free and they were tasty.  For food we got a shrimp burrito with Guacamole (that we asked to have inside the burrito) and the Diablo Chicken Salad. Guess what, the burrito came with the Guacamole on the side and, for whatever reason, the salad that goes into a burrito also on the side. Husband said it tasted okay.  My chicken salad however, where do I start... it was supposed to be the grilled chicken with Diablo sauce, sesame seeds, edamame, kale, avocado and dressing. It was entirely lettuce, a few lonely edamame, three slices of avocado with some brown spots, pretty dry chicken, and not a single piece of kale. The one great thing was the Diablo sauce which was fruity, sweet and really spicy. I notified the waiter about the lack of kale, she left the table and came back with a menu and said there's no kale in the salad, it says "edamame kale" and edamame kale are the few tiny beans in the salad. I highly doubted that there is something like edamame kale but who knows, nowadays everything suddenly comes in new fancy varieties, so maybe there is an edamame kale that looks and tastes like normal edamame. We googled immediately - guess what, there is no such thing as edamame kale. Nice try fooling the customer. We looked at the menu again and it clearly says it has edamame and kale. Seriously, if she had told me they're out of kale, ok, or they forgot it, ok. But making up a ridiculous new vegetable that doesn't exist... come on.... I almost threw a Gordon Ramsey in that place, but I'll get my revenge now with this review [insert evil laughter here].  So, I paid $12 for a bowl of lettuce and a good laugh about "edamame kale"...  To make a long story short, the food is a joke, especially for the prices and the waitress lies in your face instead of admitting even minor mistakes. We will definitely never come back.

HStxvsTUH7P7WvMw36MdCQ.text: Great ambience and service.  Mediocre mexican food.  Not terrible, just not memorable.  If you want to drink and have fun with friends this is a good bet. If you are looking for good food, try somewhere else.

ytA171xfNar_rMOLa1RuTQ.text: No. No. No. Do not waste your time or money on this place. Terrible service for an empty establishment and even worse drinks. I ordered Patron and got bar tequila. Like I wouldn't be able to tell the difference.  Go next door to Kona grill.

I5_PtKUZCtH1YvcBqB42hQ.text: The service was pretty good. However, I ordered boneless wings and  they tasted like flavorless dried chicken breast instead of wings. The shape of the wings varied, which makes me wonder if they were wings.

l2w9GJeZdeSEl9Up-3ob5Q.text: Ask for Matthew! ON POINT!! Awesome service, food and brews. Best service I've had in years, definitely coming back.

AQ488SEtMecTQ08ByAbyjg.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I have been here three times now with the boyfriend and family and everyone loves it! They have a great beer selection and the service is always good, the waiters aren't in your face too much or not enough it's the perfect amount & of course the atmosphere is great too! Highly recommend the Sonoran Dog, it's presentation is on point and super filling! I've gotten both their tacos and shredded beef burrito (fully loaded) and never been disappointed! Would HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone!

ruCX6n5zpPfA5Mgns-_70w.text: I came in for the first time a few days ago and had an amazing experience! I have pretty high standards for mexican food but the nitro nachos topped all my expectations. Our server, Denise was such a delight and made us some awesome table side guac! I will definitely be back!!

SgOyxMi1XeVTpQHoU_6gVQ.text: Been here quite a few times and have loved it! The atmosphere is great and the staff are so laid back and cool! I've always sat at the bar and they have always taken care of me! Definitely my new favorite spot! Try the chromeberry cocktail! So good!!

WIgVJ5vkF_fcCC_wrWPEMA.text: If you're really hungry, don't hesitate to eat here!  There's a lot of food.  The service couldn't really get any better either.  Not a bad experience!  I'd say 4 stars is about right.

eLiA8BAHxe0tE33c-nHb-g.text: We had such high hope for this place based on the beer list and the menu but . . . Epic fail. The bland appetizers were served by a visibly sick waiter, the beer we wanted was unavailable, and the service was. . . Very . . . Slow. Fortunately, there are a lot of great places in the immediate vicinity.

W64r-gPy51DiQ6FsJTVbqQ.text: I stopped by for Tuesday tacos and was delighted. My server was friendly and helpful with the drink menu .  The salsa was wonderful.  Interesting selection of,tacos which made for some fun!

BD5vIDtIVSGXIzc1r8riZg.text: You can skip this place for sure.  The food is overpriced and it really doesn't taste that great.  I definitely would not recommend this to a friend.  Just go around the corner as there are a lot of better options available in that immediate area.

PwNCpUDvubch3TFBL6nRoQ.text: Great food their table side guacamole  is really good as well as the tacos. We come here quite often and our server joe is always Great! They also have some of the best micheladas.

LJhLzOObAUSdxYBVIungRw.text: Hands down one of the best laid back bars to come in and enjoy your time with friends , the food was amazing (Diablo, pork) and the gluten free chips and salsa were just as amazing as the two margaritas , Our server Joe despite the 5 or 6 tables it looked like he had insured our drinks were filled and table was cleared of any dirty dishes along with the others . Couldn't help but leave $20 def the highest tip I've ever left for just my friend and myself. The manager and other employees were just as awesome coming by and checking on everyone ! Please stay !!

j6L7zlP2JP5_Z7jtAGz9Fg.text: We had a fantastic time! Joe was our server and he was energetic and very friendly! I'll be back for sure.

ywpPWh_dJJARlERNREdB-w.text: This is our first time coming back and we were so thrilled to see our absolutely favorite server ever JOE!!! He is truly the best server I have ever met. You will not be disappointed if you ask for Joe.

KYJGOXt-a7aI1K36rUv34g.text: What a piece of s*** company they sit there on the corner of the block and they can't even serve a man a drink accusing him of being drunk when he walked in there not knowing nothing so we left and we were at the Buffalo Wild Wings to everybody there leave that s*** alone and let them deal with the car out front what a piece of s*** company

d68xZRE5xy_63lG4yCCEEA.text: Yumm! We had the shrimp diablo taco (hubby said it's a definite repeat next visit) - I enjoyed the grilled fish & grilled chicken tacos... drinks were excellent (& BIG!) - great service & comfy outdoor seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States

GPl3aFBd_4Whltj-AzH0dA.text: To be clear: I did not eat at Sir Veza's The Big Restaurant Attached To The Mall. I ate at Sir Veza's Taco Garage The Place In The Food Court Because I'm Cheap.  I'm not a business analyst, but what it looks like they've done is built their restaurant right next to the food court, so they share a wall, and then carved out one of the food court sections so now it's like the restaurant has a closet that they take orders from and bring you food. You can sit there, in the food court, with the rest of the food court eaters. The food wasn't super fast, which is great because that makes me believe they are making it fresh, and "ho doggy" it did seem to be pretty fresh. It wasn't slow either though. I didn't feel like I was sitting around waiting or anything. It took the appropriate amount of time.  I ordered a Sir Noran Hot Dog or something like that. I think the name is supposed to be a play on words because the name of the place starts with 'Sir', but I don't get it. It doesn't really matter though. I'm ok if they want to call it that. Anyway, I ordered it, and it was delicious. If you like hotdogs, you'll either like this, or you're a liar.  The ambiance of the food court in general is a wonderfully grounding experience. One of the things I love about the Chandler Fashion Square Mall is how diverse the shoppers are. You can sit in the food court for an hour, and absolutely make things up, and they'll inevitably walk through the place. Ugly kid on stilts. Totally overweight woman with 3 children. Guy who looks like the monopoly guy. Just any kind of person.  Overall I'm giving Sir Veza's Taco Garage a total of four freakin' stars, because the food was delicious, and the service was great, but compared to the cool taco-garage feel of the counter, going back and sitting in the mall food court means you don't get that full-on Sir Veza's experience. Well then, why did I eat at the food court instead of going to the restaurant? Well I'm not a genius, so I don't know. 4 stars is still really good, so don't worry about it.

1_a4vi7Ldp5Lgvhz2KEg9A.text: 1 star for the good fries. Food was tasteless: My husband's hamburger was over cooked and very dry (even though he ordered it 'pink in the middle'), my son's burger was dry bun with tiny piece of meat and cheese. Pork and fish tacos were lacking seasonings, however compared to the hamburgers were ok. Probably this is good 'happy hour' place but don't waste your money on the food.

fhlkrIOChZcU4cSsvKKcaw.text: The two stars is for ambiance and location only.  Awesome location with outdoor patio area draws you in.  BUT.. service is non-existent. Servers always try to look busy doing something else.  After 15 minutes waiting for water,  went to the bar to get it myself.  Food sounded good on the menu and looks appealing inn other tables but totally flavorless and bland (No Bueno for Mexican food).  What a shame, cool name, hip location and cool setup. Now you just need to get the employees to give a shit about taking advantage of what they have.

HCgmhed3AXgENdNdzrTC-A.text: Went for the company and I stayed for the food.   We started with the guacamole and had the server be the "diver" (her term not mine). Most times they drop off the guac fixins and the table makes it to their taste. Overall the freshness was on point and it tasted good.   For my entree I ordered the shrimp enchiladas. I tired to stop eating it half way through.....I even put my sour cream side cup in the middle of the dish in hopes they would take it.....moral of the story is good food won. I ate every bite.   We did have to ask for more chips and salsa on multiple occasions. It wasn't the best Mexican food I had in AZ but it was good considering it was attached to a mall.

HgkM2HsB0spBuVFMTCXvgA.text: Sir Veza's has great happy hour prices with drinks and appetizers very affordable!  I, however, ordered a dinner of two tacos with charro beans instead of refried.  My friends who ordered off of the HH menu all got the bbq pork sliders which came with two sliders and fries--$5!!!  I, who ordered off of the regular menu, was able to choose from about 8-10 different fillers for my tacos.  I chose the shredded chicken and the carne asada which is a dollar more.  The shredded chicken was really good, but I wouldn't recommend the carne asada--too dry and small chunks of steak.  (Maybe I'm not a carne asada fan.)  They let me get more beans because I don't eat white rice.  I also liked that I could get charro beans (but not the kind I'm used to) instead of refried beans.  It's a fun place and attracts a young crowd.

tdW1CiN6NTCOAUmSD1LcZQ.text: Very cool taco and hot dog "garage"  I'm a new fan of Sir Veza's. Stumbled across the place when we decided to have lunch at the mall and yet wanted to avoid the food court. Yelp'd it and... What? A 4-star place here? Their food shall be had. Onward!  The concept is a garage restaurant-- garage decor, mechanics rags for napkins, staff in biker apparel, et al.  Cool look and vibe, along with lots of TVs to catch the games on while eating.  Menu is mainly tacos, salads, and a big sonoran hot dog. That latter was yummy as bucks. And the kids menu hit the spot with our little girls.   A bit slow on the service and the young lady kept forgetting things in her rush. She was nice enough though and I forgive her attempt to give me diabetes with an Arnold Palmer so sweet that my relations felt the pucker. She's young and with some additional experience, she'll be rocking it.  We'll be back!

JtizarNoITqoGj6ruWNs1Q.text: Meggan and Nate had wonderful service! :) they were very prompt and our meal was delish! It's our favorite place for Taco Tuesday!

mUYIpHMDIWR4d_-XREPrMw.text: First time in and experience was awesome! Not only was the food and drinks satisfying our server Meggan was on top of it. She was quick to give suggestions, attentive, and had a great sense of humor. Definitely going to recommend to friends!

ecIuIIZA4GQz_IqLo8wi_g.text: Just opened up at the Chandler mall, you'll find this sports bar at the food court entrance.  The menu is written in car jargon and difficult to understand,  but our server was polite and helped explain the different items. Food and drinks were over priced. The happy hour specials are closer to normal prices.  Seating was...interesting. The dining area is mostly outside and set up like a bar rather than a restaurant. There is also a 'lounge' area with cushioned benches and coffee tables. At the dining tables, you get either a bench seat, stool, or horribly uncomfortable chair. I had to swap out my chair for a stool shortly after being seated, and I noticed another lady also opting for a different seat.  I have to say, after seeing the high prices I was prepared to dislike this place, but we really got our value for the food we ordered. Three of us shared a full order of nachos with chicken, and it was super huge and we all loved it. Just for the nachos, I would come here again. Seriously, this thing was served on a baker's 1/4 sheet and was 8" high!!  Service was a mixed experience but mostly good. At one point I went inside for something I needed. I surely had an I-need-help look on my face but thought there were employees everywhere,  they were so focused on watching the game on TV I had trouble getting someone's attention. In a few minutes I got sorted out and went back to the mountain of nachos at my table.  Overall a good experience.

jezA7CzMvW0oJqbUaSX2DA.text: Stumbled across a Living Social deal and couldn't wait to try this new Mexican restaurant.   Ordered the Stuffed Chipotle Chicken (chipotle cream, corn tamale stuffed, poblano) with a side of calabacitas and black beans. SO delicious!!!   I came here during the lunch hour and our waitress Christin was friendly and knowledgable. Also, the food came out very quick and perfect for a lunch rush.   Didn't get an opportunity to try any of the cocktails, but they seem to have a great Happy Hour menu with cheap drinks and eats. We'll be sure to come here for Happy Hour soon.   They have only been open for 4 months and are having their Grand Opening at the end of March. Get in before it gets too busy, because this place is going to be rockin' in no time.   Gracias Sir Veza!!!!

xVRA7ooqBWW4hIy-_V4zSQ.text: Tried Sir Veza's this evening with my husband.  The staff was very nice and accommodating.  The food was great-i did not get what I ordered,  but it was still awesome.  I ordered the club taco and the Diablo chicken taco,  and I got  a plain chicken taco and a Diablo shrimp taco.  Both were really good though,  and I didn't even mention it to the waitress.    We also had the Margarita of the month that has coconut in it,  which was delicious!!    The food was a little slow to come out,  especially for a Thursday,  but thankfully we weren't in any hurries.    Overall,  it was good food and drink.  I would absolutely give them another try

tMwdrl6kjDrQ7okGqoaokA.text: Location: it is located in the Chandler mall. It has outdoor and indoor seatings close to the main food court. General areas are relatively clean and organized. However, this restaurant is more family oriented and I probably will not recommend it for a date night.   Service: it is 120% excellence. The owner basically greed us at the door while we were reviewing the menu. The waitress is super friendly and attentive. After we were seated, the owner still comes back to check up on us from time to time.   Food: we ordered shrimp ceviche as an appetizer. They put too much lime on it and it was a bit too soar. For main entree, I ordered the Soroman hotdog and it was absolutely delicious. The owner told me he moved out here from Tuson and I'm glad that they bought my favorite hotdog down here with him. I wanted to order the churrios for dessert but I was completely full at that point.   Rating: I gave it a 3 stars because (1) the comment about the appetizer and (2) their menus are a bit pricy. I might come back here again to get the hotdog. Overall, I think this restaurant is average.

7TRf5eC6Anmtz8Um8-DYSA.text: I wish there was a 0 star option. Went in last night for a few drinks. We were seated right away but no one came to take our order, or even notice that we were sitting there for about 25 minutes. All the waiters just kept walking by. It wasn't even busy. So we walked out and no one seemed to care. I will never step foot in that place again.

YYQBxzsqymGnMJ18MqubEw.text: This is one of my favorite Mexican food places to eat at when I am in the Chandler area for a few reasons: I love the decor and fun, relaxed atmosphere. My waitress, Eve was very attentive and gave me great food recommendations and excellent service. Ask for her section!! The grilled fish tacos and Diablo shrimp tacos are amazing!!  They have great happy hour deals. Sir Vezas is a must to quench your thirst and satisfy your appetite with tasty Mexican food and great customer service. Thanks again Eve!

fZ_x5jY-D6XbMlQ5BzElzg.text: Great food, we had the tacos. They were delicious and good sized. Not little dinky street tacos. The music is just very loud so it's hard to hold a conversation.

D6RxCnUWOyLR-qEeEU46cg.text: The food was good for what it was the atmosphere of the restaurant was good. We didn't get service for like twenty minutes when we got up to leave the host was very concerned got us service and the waitress on her second day was amazing she made up for the wait and helped us was cheerful kind and the staff made for a good experience. I will be back again.

s00BSgDmGGajCGnJrBf0WA.text: Visiting Arizona with some friends and came here for taco Tuesday. Our waiter Corbin was awesome and we got a good seat for watching some basketball. He gave us some good recommendations for tacos! Corbin also was considerate and telling us when our orders are coming out a little bit late.

5lrErIZLjZN1lMWlIwKKqA.text: Best patio I've been to in a long time. Weather was perfect, company was wonderful, food was awesome and service was great. We spent several hours just hanging out, drinks, appetizer, lunch, dessert. Colby, our waitress was a perfect hostess even with all the special requests we made. We plan to make this a regular weds lunch spot. Their nearly endless list of taco recipes, and the amount of beers they offer was inexhaustible. Yep, love this place!

4Fcvh255Ttu18f3OJGJmKw.text: We bought a Living Social for this place and were excited to try it out. The atmosphere is funky and fun.   We ordered the T-bucket Sampler (fries, onion rings, carnitas quesadilla, mini chimis, chicken fingers)  and the 2 tacos (carnitas and centerfold). The food was delicious and their prickly pear bbq sauce is delish! The bucket was HUGE and had plenty of food for the two of us. We had enough leftovers just from the bucket for another complete meal.  The waiter was extremely friendly and attentive. Service was quick. Our waiter even offered us a to-go drink for the road which I LOVE!  We will be back!

tKRtFcqI2uVxOPdYMUflNA.text: Good music, great atmosphere, and our waiter was very sociable. They have a vegan option on the menu which is always nice. I ordered the chicken burrito and a mixed berry margarita which were both delish.

OAOXKEAK44sIjyjK2qZRRw.text: Overall our experience at Sir Veza's was very good. The kids actually ate their entire meals, which typically never happens. Kids meals are served in a compartmentalized tray, which is great for mine who don't like their different foods to touch. They have a wide variety of tacos, and I enjoyed each one I ordered - the short rib, the shrimp with sriracha; and the fish. However, I would definitely skip the table-side prepared guacamole for $10 - it was basically four lumpy avocados thrown together with some other minor ingredients mixed in. It was not terrible; just very bland and not worth the price. I liked the ambience of the place with the indoor/outdoor seating; and they had a DJ playing music outside on the patio on Saturday night. Like others have said, service was not great, but it certainly wasn't the worst I've had either...I assume this will get better with time. My family and I will be back to try out some different menu items, and to enjoy another cold MX brew out on the patio.

DS8DU0fEk646vSkH5xuAuQ.text: I love this place. I like that it is family friendly. The service is great. The food is amazing. Everything I've tasted here was delicious. On Saturday nights they have a DJ who always plays great music and makes the atmosphere even more enjoyable. DJ shorty is the best. I will recommend this place to anyone who is looking for great Mexican food.

d67B5cN3TztwHb_VppZtow.text: First time here and the food was very good. My girlfriend and I will definitely come back, our server Katie was awesome and very helpful with what is good here. We had the T-Bucket sampler bucket was more then enough food for the two of us. The restaurant was decorated very nice and it was very clean.

0EYzgV9Db0O0RFnrHZ6UmQ.text: One of the most disappointing food establishments I have been to!  I frequent restaurants almost daily and sometimes twice or three times per day. Fish tacos where mediocre at best. Service was so bad that I regretted not going to a much higher class facility such as Del Taco or Taco Bell. Salsa was poor and when I asked for another type the original waiter said did have options  (a young employee said they had a hot "salsa" she brings in a "taste" less than 1/4 teaspoon - more of a warm vinegary pesto - I thought maybe better on fish tacos so I ordered. She disappeared never to return. After finishing 2 of the 3 bland tacos another employee walked by I requested "that" salsa she came back with approximately 1 tablespoon in a metal container that resembled a 1/ 2 of a shot glass it was less than 1/2 full. Again, poor service.  The waiter, a young man finally showed up saying he had 5 tables and was busy out in a he main room gave us the bill - in excess of $30 for 3 fish tacos and a chicken chimichanga with 2 waters that were never refilled. The room we were in was suppose to be cool, I guess if high eighties or low 90's is acceptable then it was nearing their requirements.  The music was so loud you had to yell across your table to hear each other.  I made a mistake eating there thinking quality food based on reviews but will never again frequent and will highly discourage others from wasting time or money.

Lt1v3JXK9wvEaYZBKOo3-Q.text: Perhaps my expectations were too high; regardless, they were not met.  The girl working the bar had no business working the bar, but I suppose we all had to start somewhere.  Ordered one beer, got something totally different, and she never caught on despite several comments about it not being what was expected.  Food was okay (at the time*), but nothing to write home about.  Late-night happy hour specials (appetizers) were reasonable; normal prices compared to the food we got would be a bit high.  And if you wonder why the "at the time" comment, it's because I spent a significant amount of time on the toilet the next morning.  Pretty sure the food was the culprit, and the leftovers I brought home went straight from the fridge to the trash.

yfHON0_Bo35G4IHgnIUahA.text: The atmosphere is great! The bartender was nice. The food was not too good. We just got nachos. The main ingrediant for nachos is cheese and it was horrible. It seemed like cheese whiz, yuk. It is very pricey, which we are ok with but not for cheese whiz. We ate at the bar and I did tell bartender i wash't happy with it. I complimented the shredded beef and guac. She didn't even offer to take a few dollars off b/c we weren't happy with the food. We love outside bars so much!! but sadly we probably won't go back. Just not good customer service. If I am paying 14.00 for nachos and don't like it and they don't care....equates to not going back.

1DgbsPw3aaIg7spXnb5kfA.text: First time I have ever posted a review on a place but this place made me do it. First time going with my fiance, looked like a chill spot. Sat down inside, kind of cool looking place but theme was a little confusing. Menu was an eyesore with the very different names for simple menu items. We both had a corona, almost not cold enough but not warm enough to complain about. Then we  both ordered carne asada burritos, mine was normal: hers was enchilada style. Server brings only my food out, then soon after hers came out. I take a bite of my burrito and I'm suddenly biting into a breakfast burrito. Server realizes mistake then comes and takes the plate back then has the nerve to go back to other table and grabs my order and tells me she cut it open but didn't take a bite. WHAT?? Why would i want food that has been cut open by someone else? Waited for food even though we were borderline gonna be late for our movie. Her food is now cold but I finally get my "new" burrito. So now we're rushed to finish. Both burritos were a little bland, hers was a bit more flavorful with the added sauce. Very Overpriced for quality of food. 15 dollars for a carne asada burrito? with no sides? The music was not good, way too loud, and clashes with the theme in my opinion. And the purpose of the uniform is to make sure the entire business/company looks equal/unified. Make the cook take off his "du-rag" and obnoxious hat. Just looks bad. I really hope this place turns it around because there is a glimmer of potential.

D4ZD5QPSAcXSSNtyHk6yAA.text: I went during happy hour and stayed for about 30 minutes. Everything was about average. The food to me taste more like Barfood. For some reason I was expecting higher quality food. Same with the beverages. The new trendy thing is to use fresh fruits and beverages not syrupy concentrates. I ordered and was a bit disappointed in the quality of product I received. I probably would not go back.

rbU8LfDIzzVP-l-KtuuVeQ.text: Updating my review. I've been back here a number of times. The taco salad is still the best. Most of the time it is amazing. They have their off days sometimes but they always try to make it right if needed.   Guac, tacos, taco salad, can't go wrong!!

Kona is ok... really... but this place is 1. Funner  2 better beers 3. Nice servers with fun upbeat attitude  4 really professional 5. Did I say great attitude ... 6. Smart and very time motion conscience   Love Kona.... sorta Love this place much better

Unfortunately service was slow, drinks were either all ice or really watered down... heir bloody Mary's were translucent pink... sad. Food was bland. Tacos were solar to what I make at home... not worth the money. :(   Only plus was good 90s music and chips and salsa.

P2Ugkq45x6BKb_LrWv-aAg.text: Love the taco Tuesday. Also they have craft beer and on happy hour that is awesome It's close to home and I can walk in get seated and drink a cold one !

xissLdCYxiikKLdxf9QWig.text: Came here for the second time because we had great service the first time thanks to David.  Our second time was completely comical.  Our waitress was absolutely terrible.  She would walk away while we were still ordering is one example... I even had to walk up to the bar to put in my order.  They've set the bar, now I have something to compare bad service to.    We complained to David and asked to speak to a manager and instead he took off one of our $4 beers.    We won't be back.

hqcgxWo4xO8F6Q7EINIKdA.text: Best veggie tacos I've had in a long time and Chuck was the best bar tender. I told him I liked a less sweet sangria and he replaced my sangria with a larger less sweet glass. The service was great and personal.  The open air was great paired with the mist! I'll be back!

aCdITT3fgbq5fD0oWFYU1w.text: The service is fast on a Friday lunch time. The drinks properly leveled for supreme taste and the food compliments the whole package highly recommend this place. Great staff

JgZaTtBYlEBTzQq6uD2-rw.text: PERFECT! We're vegetarian... and it's hard to find GOOD Mexican food we don't make ourselves!   Here, we can get tacos made to order, and crispy corn tortillas which melt in your mouth !  Love it!

84gtqGREfkVBTC9J259fBg.text: Just say no. This place looked like a fun place to eat. Boy was I wrong. After checking out the menu we asked the server what she recommended since none of us had eaten there before. She recommended the enchiladas and nachos. My husband and dad ordered the enchiladas and I ordered the nachos. The enchiladas came in a scalding hot iron pan and appeared to be a soup since the small Enchiladas were drowning in a sea of red sauce. You seriously couldn't even see them. No one mentioned the skillet they came in was very hot when the food was delivered and my father burned his fingers to the blistering point by touching it to move his platter around. My nachos were ordered with the carnitas which was cold and unappetizing. And I had a bout of food poisoning the next morning.   As a newcomer to the Chandler area I was looking forward to a fun and delicious meal at Sir Vezas. Let me just say, this was my first and last visit there.

R4ku9AY4KmVSw5IZD2qS6w.text: Wow, unfortunately what a let down.    This was my second visit came here a while back for some drinks and had a pleasant experience I figured we'd stop again and this time try some tacos.  Place wasn't busy my any means as there were tables open. We sat at the bar top.    The bar top was filthy, food crumbs and dirty glasses everywhere not just where we were sitting.  The bar tender came and I thought he'd wipe the top down. Nope my mistake for thinking he would do it without me having to ask.   I look over to the end of the bar and the entire corner was evidently conquered by an army of dirty dishes, pint glasses, plates, and pitchers.  The bar tender just went about his business taking orders and ignoring the mess. He brought us our beers and once again didn't even make an attempt to wipe away the previous three meals that were all over the top.    My desire to eat quickly faded, as I wondered if they were this messy out in the open I can only imagine how filthy they are behind the scenes.     Such a disappointment as this place has potential and I like the garage decor and feel.  But I will never go back to a place that blatantly disregards cleanliness.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States. No effort to even wipe down our area even after we left.
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States. The end of the bar overtaken by dirty glasses.  No excuse for a bar that wasn&#39;t remotely busy.

p_THI9L1VgLKADgcMiz8hA.text: Very mediocre at best. Service was ridiculous. Worst guacamole I ever had. The only good thing was the mango margarita.

Cnl9M77eRwVC-TSHi2oSSg.text: My husband and I tried this restaurant with reservations, since there were mixed reviews. We are pretty hard to please and we were pleasantly surprised by our experience.  I feel like this restaurant hasn't been given enough credit.    We arrived mid-day on a Sunday after a few hours of shopping.  The beer was cold and the wine was nice.  The chips and salsa was very flavorful and great to take the edge off our hunger.  Our waitress was very helpful and friendly and recommended the tacos to us.    My husband had the cerveza battered fish, the shredded beef and diablo shrimp tacos along with rice and beans.  He had both corn and flour tortillas.  The tacos were very generous in size and they used two tortillas per taco (they were smaller).  The flavor was very good for each of the proteins and cooked well.  I had the diablo shrimp and shredded chicken on a lettuce wraps, which was a nice option for a person who likes to each low carb and watches their macros.    Overall, the place had a fun atmosphere, the service was good and the food was flavorful. We would come here again and recommend that people give it a try!

CJIqe4qt5L18tcdjsMPHAQ.text: This is based on my visit to the walk up counter in the mall to the sit down restaurant.  I got a Sonora dog and it was great.  I also liked that I was give chips and salsa just like I was in the sit down restaurant. Maybe next time I will go inside and see what else they have to offer.

tCili14bYg3bMy1uwS7VkA.text: Super fun and our new Friday night spot! Love DJ, all dance music and good vibes! Matt was amazing and was attentive all 4 hours we were there! Michelada's are amazing, burnt Brussels and ribs are top notch!

MmMESLIEwwltjSD83HtLUA.text: Amazing food and great service! Probably the best shrimp taco my travel partner has ever had, and I ordered the vegetarian taco which was great!! Super fast, would definitely eat here again.

Z1YFD7H4iAX_AWj1srDS2A.text: The food was mediocre. The carne asada was too thick and maybe should be changed to steak on the menu. The steak was tough and without flavor. The salsa was blah and tasted like tomato sauce. The Las Vegas roll was good but needed a spice element because by itself it was bland as well.

wrqbpnYEJuizOHf-Q3MX3w.text: My second time here and the food is very consistent. .the prices are great the service is wonderful and the staff is very friendly. .must stop in

Ze4TuBVHq2DQYX-URmYpJw.text: I can't speak for the food, but I can say that the margaritas they have for Happy Hour are dang good!  They're only like $3 on happy hour which is basically a steal.  We were served complimentary chips and salsa even though we weren't ordering food which was really nice.  The bartender was very attentive and had a great repoir with all the patrons.

ajdGZJ3QPnItLRP5Od5iww.text: Great atmosphere and fun, service wasn't great and the food was so, so. Not sure if it was an off night, but we had water spilled on us, nasty dirty silverware, and a gentleman threw up in the floor right by our table...hoping for a better second experience someday because it has potential to be super fun.

FocTtzcCJqj6piPqJdHG_w.text: Over the top great service!  We received excellent service while eating dinner here on a Monday night.  The food was great and the drinks were outstanding.    The service  It is nice to eat a restaurant and have a server who knows about the menu and what it tastes like.  We got great info when placing our drink order and then our food order.  We never waited a minute if we needed something.  The chips and salsa were replaced when they got low.      The atmosphere   We ate outside under the large mall entry way covering.  It was comfortable and was good for people watching in the background.  I did mention we ate here on a Monday night and the large screen television allowed us to watch some of the game(even though we both didn't like the teams playing LOL)    The food  I went with a 3 taco plate and tried 3 different tacos.  It was served with beans and rice.  All three were good and my favorite was the diablo shrimp taco.  My wife had the grilled chicken enchilada flat.  We both thought the food was very great.  I was just able to "just' finish everything on my plate and my wife wasn't.  We both left full!    Overall  Having been to the Tucson locations this new one in Chandler is on par with the others.  I had a great tasting margarita and enjoyed the chips and salsa while waiting for our food.  When the food arrived it tasted great.  The automotive garage theme they have going on works.  Outside dining and the ability to watch the game worked.  With the amount of quality food and drink we got the price worked.  If you find yourself wanting Mexican food while at the mall give it a try.  It will not be the typical mall fast food and the quality here will be much better!

DjrXAwSfIWPrX_8zIqvwWA.text: This location must be under new management. The menu is a little different. We got our tacos with no meat in them and one had French fries or something in them as of the kitchen was a mess. We finally got the food runner to acknowledge us and take it back. She brought back our tacos with meat slopped in it and the tortillas were cold and getting hard. This place was amazing prior to this possible new management or the Sunday kitchen staff sucks which all the staff should be on the same standard. I will try this place one more time until I tell it to fuck off.

ZrZ6EkNizWBe2M9DyX3ASg.text: This restaurant at the Chandler mall has a great outdoor patio. Last night they had a DJ but there was hardly anybody in the restaurant.  I thought the food was good but not great.  Ice cold beer though.  All of the staff were very friendly and service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States. Rachael and Felicia eating chips

qpKHdiOrJI8g6PeP4beDgQ.text: Taco Tuesday special is amazing, and our server was great. The food was delicious, but the sangria was terrible.  A regular lite beer would have been a better option at a reasonable price.

Opo1j6v-4ciGI8OLWRkrOQ.text: My visit was for the Mayweather fight. The cover was absurd $30 per person. But considering the place wasn't very crowded we went for it. They sat us at a small table with no view of the very few TV's in the restaurant. We took it upon ourselves to sit in a better view area. And then were told that the table was reserved, but would only be relocated once they showed up. They never showed. As for the service, it was super slow. It seemed like we were the last table to get service and if we needed anything we waited forever for staff to come back around. We even went up to the bar to order our own drinks. What made it even worse is there was a group of fruit flies flying around a few tables that made it disgusting to eat or be around. I ordered a micheladas, worst one I have ever tasted. They use like the premixed lime juice, which tasted like margarita mix, no clamato. I reordered for a mojito and the same mix was used! Drinks are horrible!!! Order a beer to be safe. I would not go back nor recommend this place.

EEEIMmNKNxxShDfrs-5ESA.text: I was at the mall and it was unbelievable! The fries are amazing!! They were fried mash potatoes! This place better make it cuz this place is way better than kona grill! The atmosphere was cute and unique and the food was amazing!

2-9d77Avs2PXS3vwzprM4Q.text: This is definitely one of my favorite places to visit in Arizona. What more can you ask for. Shopping, alcohol and good food. I love that they are located right in the mall.  Their Mechiladas are delicious and refreshing. The outdoor seating is very comfortable.

WOHrPj0Mu1ne7DgRg3RejA.text: Me and my husband came here for lunch on a Saturday. It wasn't moderately busy. The servers kept walking past us without noticing us. It took a little bit for the server to come over to order our drinks. The alcohol was expensive. $10 for a margarita. We both got waters. Husband ordered the Sorrano Dog and it was very good. I ordered the Carne Asada burrito for $12.95. It only came with lettuce and a small amount of pico de gallo. Additional add ons were extra for the burrito. Burrito contained dry steak, black beans, cheese, and rice mixed with bean mixture. The filling was very dry and not very good to me. I had to eat some of my husband's fries. We also had the complimentary chips and salsa. The chips were all broken up into small pieces, like the bottom of the bag chips. The salsa was good. I had to pour it over my burrito to make it taste better.

Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States. Sorrano dog

tto-42Ge2zyCpXAerYeA9w.text: We visited this place on Cinco de Mayo. We came a bit later after their events and music must have taken place, and were seated almost right away. Our server was nice and energetic and made some great recommendations for food and beverage options. I ordered one of the specialty margaritas, the Gypsy Rose, that had Patron Silver, prickly pear and lime. It was just the perfect amount of sweet and sour. I also ordered a second marg at happy hour, a strawberry marg on the rocks. Also delicious.  We ordered the chimi bites and the $2 tacos on Tuesday. The chimi bites were amazing. The $2 tacos....not so much. I was almost full when I got them, but I thought they lacked flavor. I want to try some of the regular plate tacos next time because those sounded really great. The "new" shredded beef or chicken tacos look delicious.  For the price and the variety of specials, this place is a good find!

-3C0BCw6_04Eel7H21hPlA.text: Service needs some work for sure! Tacos are okay nothing to rave about. The best thing about Sir vezas are the nachos, ceviche and drinks!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States. Hot dog

2GSifl57R-dUoBRC4V7ECw.text: We visited a few weeks ago.  My daughter ordered a kid's meal, which was actually served on a school lunch tray and was just as flavorful.  My husband ordered 2 street tacos which were greasy (they had been grilled with cheese unlike most street tacos) and served with mediocre sides of black beans and rice.  My meal was the most tolerable, but only because I requested no cheese or dairy of any kind.  I had to wait longer as they remade my meal, because they made a mistake and originally put cheese on it.  I also had a margarita, which was watered down.  Given the poor food quality, I don't expect this restaurant to last much longer than others that have been at the spot.  But if you are at the mall and looking for "Mexican" food, I suggest Rubio's - it's much better than this place.

ZSgImFam2cB0aZ890a2G2w.text: Matt R is AMAZING!!! So friendly!!! So attentive!! Has great recommendations on the menu! The food is ALWAYS good here!

__LSS7NrIJxZuXp5Fv5dmQ.text: Great bar and restaurant!   Loved this place in Tucson and it is a good set up for Chandler fashion.  I recommend the happy hour specials and watching UofA here!

tURImkd4KNeVz-CpJBowQA.text: Matt was great! Stopped for a cold one and some jams !!! Recommend for a hang  out with friends on a Friday night.

cgsIdvgmvNzjuI3VWJOUbg.text: Food, average. We had shrimp taco, beer battered fish taco and Nana's chicken taco which was the best of the three. I couldn't taste much flavors and I missed cilantro if there was any at all. We had both sides of charo & refried beans and plane Spanish rice: also missing any flavor and cilantro again. The chips and salsa was pleasant and so was the special $3 "finish your own" Bloody Mary. Kids meal was okay but also underwhelming; grilled chicken about plus about 10 French fries and a small cup of apple sauce covered in cinnamon.  Overall everything was just OK or average nothing Wow'ed us to want to write a better review and/or return again.

P02gbM9Pu5UOOdn8d7Sr_w.text: I loved it here!! The decor was fun, the beers were cold, the food was great, and the service was exceptional.  Make sure you try the prickly pear wings!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States

n42uaFrQL9D3-w33W49PSA.text: Eh...3...3.5.  My husband had been here a couple of times for happy hour with coworkers and mentioned that I should give it a try.  I liked it more than I thought I would, but a couple of things kept it from being more stars.  We were there on 6/27 for happy hour.  Our server, Cristianna, was nice and generally efficient at circling back around to check on us.  We each ordered a $3 HH margarita and got those pretty quickly.  I didn't have high expectations for a 3-dollar margarita, and it was just that...a cheap margarita.  I ordered another one I think for only 2 reasons:  it was hot out and they were 3 bucks, but I really didn't enjoy them and they gave me heartburn.  Meh.    I ordered the 1 and only combo with the jalopy taco and that was a tasty dish.  It comes with a very small cheese enchilada, a delicious tamale, and you can choose a taco.  The jalopy taco is loaded down with ground beef, fried potatoes, lettuce, cheese, olives, etc. and I really enjoyed that as well.  Overall I think it's a little overpriced at $15.95.  It came with a side of clumpy rice and flavorless charro beans.  I ended up doctoring up the leftovers for breakfast the next day.  The tamale was really the best part of that dish.    Mr. M had the sirnoran dog with onion strings and it was a really good hot dog but the bun was way too big.  That entree was $9.95.  Now that I pay attention to some of the other pictures, we'll definitely have to come back and try those batter-dipped fries.  The onion strings were really greasy and all clumped together.  Not all that appealing.  All in before tax and tip it was $43.13.  I don't regret it, but I do think it was a bit much.    Another thing that dropped a star was the ladies' room was pretty nasty, and it was 5:30 in the afternoon.  I can't imagine how it is at 9:00 at night.  Yikes!  I would go back, but it's not high on my list.

Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States. Ice cold tasty beverages.

hxiCv0Z3rLfSsR0FGiTMzQ.text: Food: we got the Carne Asada burrito - fully loaded (rated 3 stars... It was OK... Nothing special) and the Diablo Shrimp bowl (4 stars)... The Diablo shrimp is kind of like an orange chicken I would say (a little spicy, but also sweet).   Service: not the best - I had asked for more salsa before our food came and she never brought it out then I needed a knife for my bowl (our waitress didn't bring our food) so I waited a few minutes before getting up and finding her to ask for a knife and the salsa.   I do love the gluten free options here. They really cater to that, it seems, and the servers are well-informed, which is great. They said the chips have a dedicated fryer (not fried with the cerveza-battered fish, etc.) and I haven't gotten a reaction yet so crossing my fingers on r

-9IQr372kCfnhWLSBXlKaw.text: This place is a bar and twice we had great service and twice terrible service. I think I remember getting so pissed once that I complained to the manager.  I particularly love the Diablo shrimp tacos that are half price on Tuesday. Very big and two filled me up. Once I tried to eat three tacos and it almost killed me. I don't like the beans but I like the rice. They give you a French fry alternative option with the tacos which are good I just don't like fries with my tacos cause you know mixing France and Mexico isn't a good idea. I also love the mango tea which is a good alternative to Pepsi which I won't drink. We tried the desert and I wasn't impressed it had ice cream and hot sauce which is too fancy for me.  Note this is my go to place for shrimp tacos.

XrLB7mRfXCbobMBrrKhiUA.text: This is our first time here and we just found out it's your last day in business!  I'm only writing this review in hopes that the owner sees this and knows what a kick ass place this is/was. I grew up helping my dad in the garage and he's been in the automotive industry for my whole life, so when we came in today I immediately texted him "They have a Snap-On salsa bar and use shop rags for napkins!" I'm so sad! The food here was incredible. We had a Sonoran dog, fish tacos and the street corn queso dip. Hope to see you guys in a new spot some day!!!

KvIeRIoOszd1avHygsbomA.text: AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL Been here a few times over the last couple of years.... this by far was the worst and the last time.  No greeter at the door incorporated with slow and lethargic employees who clearly have no sense of urgency whatsoever makes a very bad impression.  Had to ask for items twice before getting them.  Basics like asking if sweetener was needed when serving ice tea, completely non existent. All of this while the restaurant is slow is unacceptable to say the least. Patio furniture ripped and falling apart at the seams clearly says that the owners/operators don't care about this place.  Looks like this restaurant space will be available soon.  Good luck Sir.  If you want to stay in business at this location, you'll need it.

X-GVCKgAy43v7xI5OKltmA.text: I've been here several times and have always thought the service was mediocre to nonexistent. The icing on top was recently when I came here for dinner. We were seated. My boyfriend had time to use the bathroom and then return. I had time to book a reservation for an event. After doing all this, I realized about 10+ minutes elapsed and no one had come to say hi. So I started looking around and try to give off that body language that we were ready to order. Still, no one came. So, my boyfriend and I left. Once we stood up, someone finally realized we were leaving and offered to get someone immediately but by this time, we had already decided to go.   As for the food, it's mediocre. They do have sizable margaritas.   Layout of restaurant is kind of strange but there is a lot of open space that leads to patio, which is nice for a cooler spring/fall/winter day.   Overall, horrible service and unimpressive.

WbUsMpI7CrDxCSmeAjucSg.text: Probably the best tacos I've ever had in my life! The Diablo shrimp is the greatest thing ever!!! I don't think I've ever had a bad experience here.

WR1pbh4JrJFGXKe2x9jgGA.text: Great Micheladas and Bloody Marys.  Tacos are a solid 10 and portions are not skimpy! Great atmosphere and staff was great.  Definitely one of my favorites in Chandler.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States

7uFBLdmfXe1JF_quMBh9_Q.text: Salsa. I ordered delivery. The delivery was great, timely and professional. Next time I will dine in at the restaurant. I got a chicken quesadilla and carne asada tacos. I wanted a cheese quesadilla but the order menu would only allow me to choose a meat. So I got chicken. It was very good but missing a bit of salt and salsa. It was served with a little bed of salad with an attempt at pico. Would have been much better with a small amount of salsa. The carne asada tacos we're also very tasty. Same challenge, no salsa. I looked up the menu online and it clearly indicates that you get an order of chips and salsa with your meal and extra costs a buck. Where was the salsa? It did not arrive with my meal. Either the delivery driver forgot it. Or, the Taco Garage did not prep it correctly to include the salsa. Either way, no salsa. Guys, I live in Arizona, salsa for Mexican food is like ketchup for French fries. The salsa was missing.

26kMi59PnT4hpRUTcpFenQ.text: Is this place still open? Closed shop with no signage on a Wednesday at 6 PM, stools and chairs put up on tables. Really disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States. Ghost town on a Wednesday night at 6 PM.

KKAkeziiNHDIQf4U77NvMw.text: You can always judge a place by the quality of the salsa when it hits the table. Meh. That's the story behind this place: meh. Severely over-priced for what you get and the wait staff is clearly just counting down the minutes until their shift ends and they are freed. I'd get more customer service from a robot. Margarita was terrible, but my Corona was solid . Take your $12-13/per person and go to Barrio or Joyride if you're interested in great tacos.

jbWkJMCA61kEjtTvD8TR8g.text: Ive been coming to sir Veza's for awhile now and I've never been disappointed with the food or service. It has always been top notch best place at chandler mall hands down!!!!! Servers are always very vibrant, polite, and accommodating. The food here is amazing and authentic, you may never have to send a plate back. THE BAR: Sammy and Bobby are great assets to the joint... great drink proportions and very fast.... I NEVER LEAVE YELP REVIEWS BUT SIR VEZAS EARNED THIS ONE!!!!!!

38dClZ8oNG4qF_6FHIWhTg.text: I give this place no stars really we waited at door for a long time to be seated.  The hostess was very nice when she did get there.  We sat for at least 10 minutes before we got up and walked out.  Five severs came around us none of them even offered us water or looked at us sad service.  We just went to BJs down the way where their costumer service is wonderful.  So much for trying someplace new :(

Q8lp5j5Im9V4R7UF8PgPUw.text: This used to be my favorite hangout spot. We used to go here 2-3 times per week.   I never leave reviews, good or bad. So the fact i took the time to download the app and sign up should tell you something.   Today after a long week we walk in and sit down. We waited about 10 mins and no one ever came to our table. I had to get up and go get my menus for the girl. I sat back down and waited another 15 mins. Finally out of frustration I went up and stood at the bar. I may might as well been invisible because 2 different bar tenders walked right by me without so much as acknowledging my existence. Keep in mind it was unusually SLOW AND NOT CROWDED. There were plenty of staff just standing around.  We ended up walking across the street to bdubs where we were promptly served.   You really screwed up sir vezas, as my 2-3 trips per week will now be ZERO!

c9eSZslv6_kS_I5tQiZbXw.text: What a fun little place at Chandler mall! The food is good and the atmosphere is a lot of fun. We went on a Wednesday afternoon so it wasn't busy at all and we got amazing service from this waitress from Indiana. She knew all about the menu and was really personable   I ordered the bio bowl which is the vegan option offered on the menu. It is full of veggies, beans, and rice and it really full of flavor. I got it with some red sauce to add a little more depth and flavor. It was really good.   We also ordered a margarita pitcher which was well made and had chunks of fruit in it. A pitcher will run you about $27 and you'll get 4 drinks out of it total, not bad! They also have Pacifico on tap, which is awesome!  For desert I had the pumpkin tamale which was really good and supposedly vegan. They can also made their brownie desert vegan without an egg, but it takes 15-20 minutes to make. It's nice to see a restaurant catering to their customers. I'll definitely be back!

skOtIJ9RM5GvxjcusHFIqQ.text: Personally I wouldn't recommend out the food was not what I was expecting. Service was alright bit the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States

qSkZxX5l5A9-4xrzC67gEg.text: I love this place! They have the BEST happy hour! Everyday!   The first time I went to Sir Veza's was in the Tucson location and it was just the worst experience ever. I've also been to the one at the Phoenix airport to grab a drink from time to time. So when this location opened I was hesitant to try it out and I'm so glad I did anyway!  I've tried so many items on their menu!  The sonoran dog is really good. It's a bacon wrapped hot dog, with beans, salsa, tomato, and it comes with fries. I've also had their Johnny Vegas which is really good. The cilantro cream cheese that comes with it is delicious. Now if you ever order their burrito bowls, make sure you are REALLY hungry because this thing is huge! I got the Go Shaker Chimi and couldn't even eat half of it.   Their margaritas are also really good! and are usually on happy hour. I recommend the strawberry one on the rocks, Get the 14 bomb!   The customer service has always been good. I love their outdoor patio. It is also dog friendly. (I've taken my little monster with me) And it even has a photobooth! What more can you ask for!

h87Fk_3mwbgS7RGtmd_UGQ.text: I really do like this place, this is my third time coming here and it's always been good. This third time I have came however was a bit different the staff seem confused and a little slow with the drinks and food, mind you this is the day after thanksgiving. Overall still a good place to check out good food good times the indoor decor is also really cool give you a an old rustic garage feel. This place gets the Carlos one thumb up.

TZ_68Ra_scXhbYUn1BEckQ.text: Meals served in elementary school cafeteria trays, the paper under the burritos gets soggy and when you're done you realize you have eaten half of it and the service is incredibly slow. I won't be back.

nwLng5v63SRlRPfWYeflbw.text: Very, very good. As soon as I saw this popping up in the mall I was interested. I just visited for the first time and was a worthwhile experience. They have a variety of nice beers available, and the happy hour(s) are generous. I do particularly like the open air bar setup they've got going on, especially since they've  kept it very clean. Fast and friendly service. Definitely get the SirVeza fries. They are incredible.

NdVvAQBSo5v739g7dDm1bg.text: Good food and service! Worth trying. Looking forward to warmer weather to enjoy the patio.

UisiYpwtu8ZUEUHIMeQ49w.text: We had a great time here thanks to our server Deena. I couldn't decide what to get and she was very helpful with her sugestions. The guacamole was excellent. I finally decided on the cerveza fish tacos. Yummy!  Can't wait to go back.

_aNEBngyPM8NeG9haGasWg.text: Horrible experience! We waited 15 mins before we even were seen by a waiter took our order and drink order at the same time. We had to go find someone to get us chips and salsa. Our friends ordered an appetizer never came out. Told waiter they didn't want appetizer anymore since we received our meals. Lack of communication between all employees even the GM Matt that was their.then My husband order one of burgers, as he was eating pulled paper out of his mouth  (the paper that they use to grill the meat). This was no little piece either about 2inch. He spit out his food and showed one of the employees which showed the cook. They took the burger off our ticket. There was to many people involved on our ticket, Again lack of communication. As we were leaving we talk to the GM Matt since he never came to our table after everything that went wrong. Our friend told GM really need to work on the communication between everyone. He said to her well it's none of your business but I'll be talking to them. Damn right it's my business if I'm being a customer here and it effects me. We asked who is above you he said I'm owner  (well that explains  alot)  we told him we would Google it then he gave us the other 2 owners name. Well I was not going to write a review until my husband was up all night in the restroom needed up going to the emergency room this morning and told him. He has food poison! Will never eat there again. There was so much more but these were the key factors.

CXwmPukGypDS0aAi9KtWPQ.text: Joined a happy hour party here. This place was not my scene. I liked the feel of the restaurant with the big open walls to the outside. It's probably a better place for drinking then food. Had some seriously bad chicken, rubbery. Service replaced it quickly. My peeve is they bring these baby sized cups of chips out and your constantly having to ask for more chips which takes forever. It's not a total loss as a place to go. Drinks and appetizers are a great deal. Food wise there are other excellent Mexican restaurants in the valley better than this place. Still if your with friends and looking for a chill spot it's great for that.   Brett Russo

bxHWqk_lj9uKAYYeNU8R7g.text: Good tacos and drinks. I come here almost every time I'm in town. Nothing fussy - just solid.

avzGb2GoRaoYtjMAbK2qEw.text: I tried this place at the Phoenix Airport.  I ordered the Veggie Bowl; imagine my surprise when the only veggie was one very small slice of onion - I'm serious - that was it!  Approximately 10% of the rice was so hard it was not chew-able.  I'll never eat there again.

IARVeUxAU2tECVvUvhgfqw.text: Johnnys the man ask for him food was bomb such a friendly guy first time here will be back for sure thanks Johnny

O4R50ZLN74PYhblM1PnlvQ.text: Honestly not that great of a place. Have not tasted the food but the drinks were not good. My suggestion is to go to kona right next door.

DtDSzRPmEszqitr5cpLdaw.text: I have written about this place once before and the second time we went almost a year later is NO better..... Waitress sara greeted us, it took another 10 minutes to take our order and she was no where to be found. Don't know the guys name but he deserves 5 stars and he took our order, made our apetizer made sure our food came out right and had to catch a ride. We tipped him. Manager asked if food was ok and before I or my husband or friend could ask anything, basically ran away. She asked if we needed anything else, we said boxes and the check please. She brought boxes and asked if we wanted dessert. I'm a server myself, I know the deal, if I ask for a check it usually means I don't want dessert. We asked for the check a SECOND  time and she comes back saying "I don't know what you ordered since I didn't take your order so how do you want me to split it".  Seriously, in my 11 years of serving I have never, NEVER, said that to a table..... Also to include the last time we were there the manager told the server that if she wanted an amount taken off the bill SHE WOULD HAVE TO PUT HER OWN HARD WON TIPS TOWARDS IT EVEN THOUGH IT WASN'T HER FAULT THAT OUR FOOD CAME OUT AT DIFFERENT TIMES ALONG WITH OUR APETIZER COMING OUT THE SAME TIME AS OUR BILL!  This place pissed me off again and I will never go back unless they hire ppl who are willing to work and actually make sure their tables are ok.

OuKi6Zj7-Sf_x-u5QMzdDw.text: Matt made my experience fabulous !! Very attentive , courteous with fast service . Matt went above and beyond thank you for all your service. I will definitely return & request Matt to service my table again.

02mBpI3j_9wbBd7TLKLY9Q.text: I tried the car club chicken tacos with corn tortillas and it was amazing! They were bigger than I expected them to be for being corn tortillas. We went back for taco Tuesday and got the 2 dollar happy hour tacos. They are pretty small but good. It was a nice surprise to see four peaks peach ale on tap since usually places only have kilt lifter. I will be back for sure. Nice to have this place close by.

pUGL9_jLWPSAXOLAZ89AzA.text: The chip's and Salsa are good, but the happy hour sliders were not all that great. I ordered a Mango Margarita and my waitress for got to put my order in so I never got it.

XQkPS7t2FaMZMT0VMjy3zA.text: A little high on the price but worth it. I've been here twice. First time I had a burger and fries. Outstanding! Second visit was boneless wings with diabolo sauce. Amazing!!

qCxHkF8Mm1SukVYBgOHmig.text: I have to say I am pleasantly surprised. I ordered the bean dip to start with the chips and salsa. It was delicious. The chips and salsa were OK but not that good.  I ordered the nachos. When they came out they were huge.  They were filling and tasty.  The server we had was awesome. He was running back and forth to make sure we always had everything we needed.  Needless to say we tipped him well.  The ambiance of the restaurant is great because it is kind of inside, but no walls so you can see outside.  The have a DJ every day.  I feel bad because they are in the infamous cursed location of Chandler Mall.  No place ever lasts there. I can't say I for sure would eat here again without the Living Social deal I got for this restaurant. It is a little pricey.  The Nachos are definitely worth the money, but from what I can see on the Yelp pictures it looks like everything else may be a little overpriced.

fs_Hfkq_M92wlav89d5Liw.text: Long wait on food, poor quality as well. Greasy , skip and hit up Dell taco. Kitchens dirty, and slow. I recommendation is to not bring family Here very irregular and confusing "style".

kbkk3ShdPLNaYKiw0moueg.text: The service was great. The food was not impressive. For the price I paid for a sirnoran hot dog I was expecting better taste. The bun was cold, I personally like the bun to be warm. We also order a taco salad, the taste was much better than the hot dog but the ground beef was cold. I think for a bar it looks pretty cool and the service is awesome, our server and manager were great, but for food I will not be coming back.

XVt6LdwSa0ETt9mdhumtZA.text: very good food,better than I accepted. price of menu items are a little high but they make up for it with large portions. I had the most interesting vegetables in the world as an appetizer which was a mix of green and red peppers, onions, jalapeno, broccoli, and pickles all fried in a tempura batter and served with a side of chipotle ranch! I also ate their carne asada tacos which where also very good. over all I would eat there again!

W452Q4e02cmbo_YYEkHAoA.text: We love Mexican and are pretty picky about it. I have been here twice and thought it was excellent both times! The margaritas and chips and salsa are both delicious! (And that's the True test of yummy Mexican right?!) I had the chopped salad and it was very good. Huge portion. The kids meals have great options which we love as well. Service was great both times we went.  I'm a fan!

TSNWG1f6yDLGrz6gR1P-yg.text: I tried this place a couple weeks ago. The bartenders and servers here Are attentive and I was treated like family the first time I came in. The food is good atmosphere is great and friendly staff. I will be a regular glad it's in my neighborhood.

9sDVheNlG5SP_qUXfRCu1g.text: The first time I went to this restaurant I was extremely satisfied. Their food is amazing, the atmosphere is fun, and the servers are all unique and entertaining. However, as I kept going back, it seemed as though the service got worse and worse every time. Being a vegan there's only a few things I can eat at this restaurant but their Bio Fuel burrito is so good I wanted to branch out. I went by myself on a weekend during lunch to order the mushroom tacos, only to be served bean tacos with 3 pieces of small mushroom in each one. The mushrooms were nowhere in site, and when I asked why they were called mushroom tacos or if I could get more, she simply answered "if you wanted something else maybe order something else next time." The next time I went back, the vegan burrito (it's on the menu as vegan) was served to me with meat in it and they were huffy and puffy when I asked them to remake it, and the last time (probably the last time for good) the rice in my burrito was so over cooked and mushy it was inedible. My boyfriend also got a dish with rice on the side and they served him white mush as well. I'm giving 3 stars because when the food is cooked right and you get a good server the place is worth 5, but when it's wrong it's so wrong it ruins your entire meal. Unfortunately, I don't recommend for anything other than cocktails during happy hour!

tgDfjnVc3Z15qJVthz--og.text: I know this spot is cursed, due to many restaurants closing at this spot. However, this place seems like the new touch of tuscon desert needs and fills a valid role in Chandler fashion square. To be honest I was not willing to go at first and got dragged here by my significant other. To explain the service I doubt I could do it justice. They were willing to let us sample all their flavors from cheese to several of the beers before deciding. They were very attentive and caring for a chain restaurant. I understand this is the fifth in the chain. The food was great. Actually the portions were larger than expected and the flavor was not skipped. I have tried at least three of the tacos. Not to mention diet friendly for my vegan and gluten free friends. Just wow. I don't normally dish out a four star rating a first time but this place really has it. Even the rice is good. Something most places overlook. It's blooming with cilantro and flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States. Big tvs!

rY5og69VR8tgtwz9mePKdA.text: This used to be our go to spot. I am not sure what the hell happened within the last month but it sure has changed. My gf sat at a table for over an hour and did not have anyone approach her table. An hour seriously? She ended up going to the bar to get a drink. She even went to the hostess twice asking for someone to help her. I showed up and had to wait 15 min and no one came over to help me either. Lots of people walking around which u didn't know if they worked there or not. Finally, my husband came in after finding a parking spot and ended up going to the bar to get us drinks. Then after flagging someone down to ask if he could help us he said he needed to see who was waiting on our section. He came back and said he could help us. Btw I ended up speaking to the operations manager and imposed the question.."does it normally take an hour to be waited on" in which he had a nice smart ass response im not gonna repeat. We finally ended up with a cool waiter which turned out to be way awesome but trying to get over the shitty service for the first hour and a half was a bit difficult. Well needless to say, we used to. Key word.. Used to love this place. Now I'm not so sure. I will be spending my money elsewhere because no one should have to wait an hour to be waited on! I'm not sure wtf they are doing there but with service like that they won't be having repeat customers.

i7nOlHtRs5-nLhMxWTv-xQ.text: Just tried this place for the first time and love it! The enchiladas that came in a skillet were amazing.  My husband had the carne asada burrito which was really good as well.   No gristle like some places have.   We really enjoyed the music too.   Great food and atmosphere.  We'll definitely be back.   P.S. And a quick shout out for the chips and salsa ;-)

q3zBNq0mDsYlAsD962e5-Q.text: What a beer for $3!  Yep, at Sir Veza's.  The help started by asking us if we wanted a quiet location which we did.  That's important because there's karaoke here.  We ordered a mix of drinks from wine to beer to margaritas.  All were good.  For dinner, I ordered a burrito covered in red sauce.  It was excellent and really too much for one person.  My wife had a pulled pork taco and a veggie taco.  Both tacos were good.  We choose this restaurant because it was close to our hotel but glad we found it.  We'll be back during the next Spring Training.

HZ8fuPxAQRsZsHgsymeb7g.text: Had dinner at Sir Veza and I have to say review of this place is 1 out o f 5.  The food was not very good, margarita was very weak, rice tasted like it came from a box. No flavor in the Carne asada tacos, shrimp was good. My sons chimi very dry and bland. The waiter was not customer service friendly. Never again will we go, only positive thing was the manager discounted 22% off the bill.

8M8cwNLrDwF_me4Lj9a_fw.text: We decided to try this place since Kona was packed. There happy hour food was pretty much all fried food nothing healthy. Nor was any of it to write home about . the so called spicy was sweet. There was 6 of us we all ordered dinner and not one of us was impressed what so ever.then or dirty plates sat in front of us for over a half a hour tell I see our girl and I asked her to please take them away.  So not impressed with this place. Don't think we will be back:((( we will stick with Kona grill

4MAXtPEB5sBGo0GACvvS6g.text: Cool place to hang out at the mall. We will definitely be back to watch games and hang at the bar. The garage theme is cool, and it'll be great to hang out on the patio in the spring.  The shrimp tacos and carne asada tacos were excellent. portions are big, not those little sample size tacos. Try it out if you are at the mall or looking for a good place to day drink or go for happy hour!

Y0xDy93HMvnZgBMlXdFDaw.text: Best sports bar/ restaurant in Chandler. Great TVs with volume for events. They play great music and have live music as well. The food is absolutely awesome also very good variety. They also have the best Happy Hour in town. My friends and I now have a new place to have fun and enjoy great food and taste lots of crafty beers.

lxi6ueytl9Vfyy8CE5oMBQ.text: They have awesome gluten free wings! My wife and decided to share them. The cook accidentally threw some deep fried onion rings next to them and contaminated the order. So they gave my wife a whole new order and let me keep the old order. Then the manager came over to make sure we were okay and told us about their new line of gluten free beers. He gave us a freebie on the house! My wife loved it. It's called Dogfish Head Tweason Ale. Has hints of strawberry! The place was very good to us & we will definitely be back!

1W557OtJJT3lFYxjZUv1tg.text: Also used a living social deal.  Great place, beautiful pation, great food, and awesome day time bartender!

y0b8BRVhb7NA-tqcC_MrlA.text: Can clearly see warmer all food comes out of. Not impressed, and why an open kitchen with greasy walls? Nit appealing.

5p-dI1D1HC6Gnz7tc56j8A.text: Great new concept from Tucson. Same food as el charro but set in casual, comfortable, cantina setting. A must try. Also @ airport

BfiKAEXejSkRrf2iBf6zaQ.text: They have and amazing food and excellent customer service. Also if you follow on Facebook all kinds of deals plus music. This resturant was a fun place.

J1C_uJa9V5mCsaq2_f4JzQ.text: Seriously this place is amazing! This is exactly how food should be made. The nachos with pork and prickly pear sauce are incredible.

VMVDLMD3DQrGLUV9Pn1UnA.text: Our second time and this food and unique margaritas are really awesome... The tacos are also very good and several unique taco varieties... Killer salsa

I0_gKu8iiNzSl3zuyM-D_A.text: Ladies margaritas $1 on Mondays! They definitely have the best happy hour in town! Love this place!

eLktY0jx_-8a9SRCf0y5JA.text: AWESOME doesn't come close! Love the way the girls and guys dress. The food is great especially the Carne Asada Taco's with their beans yummy! They have the tall beer that you can only order if there's 3 of you awesome if there is a group.

4TIUCHyShqyG6JSFJ7Vc7w.text: Delicious food; fast, friendly service. Will definitely be back!

aBDlInop0B91SlghT8Jf3w.text: My experience here was nothing spectacular but overall decent. I sat at the bar and had a cheese crisp with green chilis and a sangria. They make their own sangria daily and it was good, not too sweet and they even offered to sub the sprite for club soda. Great bartenders, crisp chips and good salsa.  It was the perfect segue from a hot car to some serious shopping at Macy's

xVujcnuIqzpGMw0Kjs9C5Q.text: I had been wanting to try this spot for a couple months now, so today me and my bf decided to have lunch here. Oh boy!! What a mistake that was! The food was alright however the ambiance and customer service was TERRIBLE!! First off, when I walked in I tripped over their bent front rug (very irresponsible) then the hostess says "table for 2" (blank face) no hello nothing! She then starts walking away from us so we followed her confused. We were sat on a wet booth then it seriously took 15mins just get chips/salsa & waters. Once we got that the waiter disappeared for another 10mins we had to wave him TWICE to get his attention. We finally get to order enchilada stacks with rice & beans. Another 15mins passed and we get our enchiladas. The waiter says the rice/beans will be out shortly "odd" but we still remain friendly and patient. Beans come aprox. 5mins after (no rice)We end up finishing our meal and still NO RICE. At this point we are done with this place and ask for the check. And surprise!! We are being charged for the rice we never got! We asked for a discount but were cut half way through our request due to our waiter snatching the receipt off our hands and running off. As we walked out we passed our waiter and other employees and no goodbye or thank you (not to mention we never got an apology for the rice incident).  We had the worse time here, we go to this mall VERY often but will NEVER step foot In this establishment ever again!!!!

A8jZ-lMIP8k-I6CfNKsaWA.text: Great service, great deals especially on taco Tuesday. Everything is half off on Tuesdays and the tacos are perfectly portioned and you could add another taco for half off to.

wVlmKi0BEvdaWR_oXnZoyA.text: We love coming here! Cheap drinks, free chips & salsa, & delicious food. The staff is usually really friendly, and the music choice is awesome. It's our happy hour go to

1xQqYNO9rwcThjh1k_tDvw.text: Visited Sir Veza's in a little over a year and the service at the bar was outstanding! No matter how busy they got, the staff, in particular Sami never forgot about who she was serving. Their selection of drinks and happy hour food menu was way beyond the expectation. Also, knowing what you want and how to make it was unprecedented. Definitely a top recommendation on my list of places to go for service alone!

zmgGvE_ewkOGI_MYXFnSkw.text: Chips n salsa, good drank, good thangs!!!! Staff is super friendly and the environment is on point.
