E2W5eoiOc_r8VmQY7oZR_g.text: They made us wait 25 minutes for 4 vegan tacos and then brought the wrong ones.... I said to the waitress that I didn't want them remade because it took 25 minutes to make and I didn't want to wait another 25 minutes to get the correct tacos. She said " oh ok" and took the tacos away.   The guacamole legit tasted watered down and I had to add salt, pepper and hot sauce to make it edible.   This was a BAD experience and I'm not happy at all... when your kitchen messes up you should say something more than "OH OK" and you should also ensure that IF I was to get it remade it wouldn't take 25 freaking minutes for VEGAN TACOS.

B0g3Hf83SPJ8B_Mzh8DOxA.text: This place is awesome, perfect spot to come to before or movie or even while your shopping at the mall since it's attached to it.   Everytime we been here we been lucky to have the same bartender with the bandana and he's remembered us each time.   The craft beer lineup is good and full of local breweries and if you want some good tequila shots they got that too.   I recommend the don Julio 1942 it's smooth and hits the spot.   The food is really good you can't go wrong with anything,  and we showed up on a Sunday and it was happy hour was 3pm to close.   If your in the area you have to check it out, haven't seen it to packed but real good vibe and friendly staff

J9D_WAF_b_4QGqss1gMCtw.text: Worst dining experience in a while, and I recently ate at a Chili's. It started out okay we got seated quickly but that's the only kind thing I can say. Our waitress disappeared so often we had to ask two other people to look for her. And then had to wait 15 more minutes before she showed. She brought us the wrong drink and after offering to discount it, the manager came and told is he couldn't, we let it go just so we could get out of there. The appetizer was terrible and we would've tried something else except, you guessed it, our waitress had vanished into the ether. It's not worth sweating your ass off in steel seating. Trust me.

_BRtLgbkwP9eGqxkEA2lyg.text: Sit at the bar to get good service. The corn dip was not good, bland and jus a can of sweet corn thrown in really. I was quickly given the edamame and that was good. Wanted to give an extra star for the bar staff but the food......

VRlhntiwV2VGgUluzS49ow.text: So,  we habe been here once before when it very 1st opened. I was relatively uncomfortable at that visit as all the servers looked like strippers, and can't remember much of the food...HOWEVER,I wanted to give it another chance,  and this time was different! All the servers were dressed and of different body types! The food was delicious.  Hubby got the shredded beef bowl,  and I tried a bowl as well! Yum,  and plenty left over. They have a great kids menu too! We used the check-in offer for a pumpkin tamales, but they were out so they substituted it with fried ice cream which comes with churros! Amazing!!!!

MUgAui2NnhuApRTTYzdCyw.text: Monday around 6, seated on the patio quickly. Got our order taken quickly and the food came out within a reasonable amount of time. We got fish tacos, nachos, cheeseburger, kids chicken and rice and a chicken bowl. Everything was good and the nachos were huge. Half price margaritas and I was also able to get 5%cash back using the yelp app. We weren't crazy about their style of rice, I think it was parboiled but it was fresh and hot.

cOdmnJ-qAERv4pJQw7hpOA.text: They have decent happy hour with a lot of beer on tap. Our food was good, I got the shredded chicken bowl and my boyfriend had the carne asada bowl. The staff is a little all over the place but we were at the bar and the manager or owner (not sure of his title but you could tell he was in charge) had good customer service and was really made sure we had a good experience.

7W4q5vybxQ1diBbgjaf7Hw.text: Love their Tacos and chips but lately the wait staff has been poor and today the chips were dark and saturated in whatever oil they use. Another waitress (not the ours cause we saw here once every 15 min) said they didn't change them but depends on who makes them each morning (it's 3pm) so that sucks on two different levels. all in all tacos are still good but some wait staff and cooks need to be retrained.

1uZARSyoKWMwSaU-Q0u7UQ.text: Lovvveeeee this place! Been a couple times the manager and waitress I've had when there are absolutely amazing and very accommodating! The margaritas are off the chain and the food is even better! Definitely a great taco Tuesday spot!

GSS41lcXQlaswgVv56R0Jg.text: When I get charged 50 cents for a side of barbecue sauce...I'm not coming back any time soon.

6SkCXMOHUUhf_H8gaYaM-A.text: I guess I expect too much in the form of actual service. We sat for 10 minutes after we ordered before receiving our drink order. The excuse was the bar was backed up. I'm literally counting customers- 5 at the bar and 5 tables. It's not busy and if the bartender cant handle that load, she needs a new job. Food is average. I know I get jaded when the service sucks. But seriously, how difficult is it to check on your table? And why is it that servers haven't figured out that the more beer they serve, the better their tip?

8Zcif3yPxqeg5g3mmOVoNA.text: First time here and HOLY HOT DAAAMMM!! This place Rocks! It has a car garage character, and I'm a car guy so thumbs up. The original plan was to just to shop around in the mall real quick, and decided to have a quick beer since I was Hangry.   Then guess what?  Ordered one drink called the Sirchelada. Don't know what it is? Come try it. Well one great drink led to another, you know how it goes. Then for the snacks. Rocket edamame sure is fire. Lift off.  This was a short trip but definitely will be back for more.

uiQ1B3mf7RVbmfRZpkQNUg.text: Been here in the past, for lunch and they UFC events. Their food is pretty good however they servers seem to not be consistent. Being her over 20 mins , finding bugs in two of my drinks and no round chips and salsa. I wish that she had offered me a free drink or something for the wait and inconvenience. qYoyCaRZnyfpxXUO5Es59A.text: We had went there this evening, we sat on the patio area(for 2 hours), me, my husband and daughter, first I would like to say this used to be our favorite place to go to, as of tonight I would like to say I don't think we are going back, we didn't have the greatest service, we walked in thru the patio area, a waitress "asked us if we wanted a few menus" as we were already seated(which was nice of her). Our server came and took our order, she was nice, brought us water, I did assume that they stopped serving chips and salsa as we did not get any with our water like we used to get when we used to go before, but then I saw every table around us that got them, even the people at the bar. My husband ordered the Street Corn, without Tajin on it, he doesn't like tajin, (the server that asked us if we wanted menus is the one that ended up bringing my husbands corn out to him, and it had tajin, he told her that he did order it without it, she grabbed it, and said oh ok, we can get you a new one, which was nice, but then walked away and rolled her eyes, she was kind of a snob) we could of done without the eye rolling, not my fault she doesn't like her job, it would of been a little better. Also when we order beer a tall one, you might as well order a regular one, all the beers for some reason we're at least 2-2 1/2 inches away from being full from the top of the glass, why is that. My Nachos, that's another story, I don't know where I've ever gone some where and had cold Nachos where the cheese was not melted? Here's a tip, you guys should put the meat beans and cheese on them and broil them and then out the other toppings on, that's just an idea, and less water in the pico and warm the meat up too please. My Sir Chelada was good like always. But this time was a disappointment overall.

Us80uimrSq7fuZR6bftSNQ.text: This place was pretty terrible. Only went because we had a groupon, server did a good job but the food was terrible. They had a DJ at 4 in the afternoon on a week day, it was just all around bad. Perhaps a better option for the younger crowd that needs to feel like they are in a night club. Won't be back.

The Happy Hour Menu is one of the best around. The beer and tequila selections has something for everyone.

Sc4yoPz_mX60KFwHKCT34A.text: Nice, laid-back place with decent food and drinks but expensive for what it is (outside of happy hour).

fRVnZZ6pifq1FMnxXbcBiw.text: We tried this place out for Happy Hour and we were not impressed.  Service was spotty, house margs were weak, we had to ask for chips and salsa and when we finished the small amount brought to us, we were never asked if we wanted more.  I tried the tamale pie corn fritters.  They were uncooked in the middle and lacked flavor.  We also got the papas locas which are cheese fries.  The description says cheddar, but it was actually a cheese sauce and the fries were drenched in it.  The fries were mushy, and not just because of the enormous amount cheese sauce.  The BF got the chicken sliders which he said were "ok".  Nothing about this place makes me look forward to going back...so we probably won't.

9AdLHhMnENwMU9b7jkI82g.text: I've been here 3x thus far and each time has been a great experience. The food is always incredible, their Long Islands are perfection and the staff is always willing to assist you w/ anything. NAgE6eCADqyKwYRzWHwqiQ.text: The food was pretty basic for Americanized Mexican food. What won me over was the service. Really on top of their game and I truly appreciated it with the accommodations they made.

YIPnmiOGDfYTs-EIo0qmmg.text: We decided to try our Sir Veza's while taking a break from Christmas shopping. We heard about it about 2 months ago when we were in Tucson on a weekend get away. While there we ate at place called El Charro and the owner told us he was opening a new restaurant near us.  The restaurant was auto garage themed but I think the restaurant  is suffering from an identity crisis because the building mentioned nothing about being a taco garage, only yelp totally us that.  Service was good, but they served Pepsi products (not a Pepsi fan). Second the food was so so. The chips and salsa were great, but our appetizer was a big bucket of oily fried foods. Enough so, that had we finished all of it, we probably wouldn't have felt great. The portions on items that went by our table were huge, maybe too big. All and all, I've say it was average, not horrible, not great, just average.

VXKkonBXjOVGO0E0oT1rUA.text: This place is alright. The car theme is pretty cool and it's tastefully decorated with a nice layout. Decent menu selection of Mexican food and a full bar. Food was better than I expected and was served quickly. We had an awesome waitress so our service was great. Prices were reasonable for the quality. Entire place was clean, including the restrooms. Will come here again if in the area. (I didn't get the "Sir Veza's"= cerveza, as in the Spanish word for beer, until after I left. hahaha)

SgNjT6IRAAwYqbt43yOwng.text: Food was terrible.  Hostess had a bit of an attitude.   Our Server was nice.   Drinks were ok.   We won't be going again.

D7izGsaMLSkkpj9X1zjtrQ.text: I have been here 3 times now for the Senoran Hot Dog, I would have to say the food is inconsistent. On a 1-10 scale my 1st visit for the Senoran Dog was an 8, the 2nd visit a 9, but the 3rd visit was only a 4. I'm not sure if I will be back after this as the hot dog tasted steamed not grilled, the charo beans were cold, and overall the ingredients just didn't taste fresh. I visited the location at 11am so it wasn't like everything was sitting out all day so I'm not sure what happened. I hoped for a good east valley location to satisfy the Senoran Hot Dog craving of the famous El Guero Canelo. Also some fresh salsa would be nice, not to sure why they provide pre-packaged salsa unless trying to go for the fast food thing. Have your servers fill some to-go cups with fresh made salsa, would probably be a lot cheaper too.

bQPaheBOAdTUAzkUltcGeQ.text: I was pretty excited to try this place. We were told to seat ourselves and someone would come by.... 20 minutes later, I got a walking by waitress and asked her if she could get someone to bring us menus. She was super apologetic. The food was less than decent. I had chicken tacos which was good and a carne asada taco which was NOT, bland no flavor. Service was slow, place was not too busy. Not impressed. Not worth my money, even with the discount I got from Living Social.

e8puVC4oOHVmS6KsVPw94g.text: Came here to watch some Sunday afternoon football, lots of tv's all over the place. We decided to order the tower of beer (120oz), but they stick a huge water bottle (guessing it's filled with ice) in the tower, which we figured took up about 10-12oz. We also found a bug floating in the tower, that never ended up coming out so I'm guessing he'll continue to float around. Hopefully they washed it thoroughly after us.  The service and location was really good, just a couple things they could fix... happy hour prices are always really good! Didn't try their food, but it appeared everyone else was enjoying it.

Lx-OanaS3kkqAl_XOoTUvg.text: One word fits this place, AMAZING.    We had seen this Taco Garage but never stopped so figured it was about time.  We definitely were not disappointed.  We loved the appearance of the inside which offered tables with views of the walk-ways or rounded booths.  There were TVs and specials offered every day.  Our server was Nicole and we definitely were not disappointed with her either.  The same word, AMAZING, could be used to describe her as a server.  We had been warned that the taco salad was huge.  That description was no wrong.  Not only was it huge but it was also AMAZINGLY delicious.  We both agreed it was the best taco salad we had ever had.  Great place and I'm sure we'll be back to try some of the other foods offered on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States. Taco Salad -- Delicious !!

CBj46wj_IupK2d2tXH56Bw.text: Tucson's Savory Invention: The Sonoran Hot Dog!  No need to go to a doguero [hot dog vendor] to get a Sonoran Dog in town.  Sir Veza's serves up their take on the Sonoran called, "El Sirnoran."  El Sirnoran Dog is eight-inches of 100% Angus beef hot dog wrapped in applewood bacon with beans, jalapeno salsa, and tomatoes topped with a drizzle of mayo and mustard.  Knife and forking this bad boy isn't too embarrassing because holding this wiener to your lips is borderline NSFW but dang is it delicious.  I also tried their flavorful Enchilada Stack with shredded beef and topped with an egg.  I never had enchiladas topped with a fried egg before but I'm not sure I want to eat them without an egg ever again.  The yolk porn... my goodness! For drinks, I got the Mexican Mule which was okay. I liked my friend's Mint Condition Mojito a lot more!  They have an amazing Monday-Saturday Happy Hour menu from 3-7PM and 9PM-close.  I think I'll be back only for their Happy Hour specials.  As for their Sirnoran Dog, as good as it is, I rather get my dogs from a doguero at some local Mexican joints around town.  3.5 stars!

pWm1BP68njGfWFjsqp4qTQ.text: What a great spot @ the Chandler Mall. Stopped in yesterday while taking a break from shopping.  Bartender greeted us right away & we requested to sit out side on the patio & people watch.   Our server came quickly and took our drink orders. Got the Diablo Wings & Queso Dip. Great prices throughout the menu. The Happy Hour deals you can't beat. $4.95 for many popular appetizers. Delish eats, however the wing sauce was a little sweeter than we had expected. Would have liked more heat! Still delicious!   Prickly Pear iced tea is unusually tasty & a must try!  A fun place! Great concept which gears itself as a garage style atmosphere. The napkins are actual red mechanics rags!   The wait staff friendly. Attentive and professional.  Nice menu choices and fair prices.

rfj8bKuyKAuE3mNmxvQgYQ.text: This was my FIRST TIME here AND MY LA LAST!! From the moment I walked in to when I left. The hostess was not welcoming, not even a greet, she just stood there with no smile lol and I asked for a table for two and started walking away to the table should would seat us.   Now the waiter, took almost 15 MINUTES to take our drink and food order, I had to waive him down from across the restaurant to get his attention and when he walks up at least he admitted that he "totally forgot about us." We were very close to walking out which we should have done.... the elder couple behind us always walked away because they were had no order taken, and only waters. That's is absolutely sad to see this elder couple walk out.   Our food came out, well only partial of it. He came out with our enchiladas and mentioned that our rice and beans will be out shortly which was only correct for our beans as OUR RICE NEVER CAME!   The next time we saw him we asked for the check. And at this point you should assume that there would be a discount for the rice right?! Exactly that's what I expected too but nope he brought our the check and no discount so as I was ready to pay I asked him to please add a discount for rice that was never served. As we walked out he got a dirty look like we were the problem. Very ducked up, makes me feel like I should not had left a dollar for ... "effort"??? Yeah never coming back again and hope no one does.   The food was aight though....   UPDATE! So happy this place is no longer there!

CcjBvNkl5mYCSjUgkXw27Q.text: Recommend the carne asada bowl!! My favorite part was definitely the seasoned tostada they added to the bowl. And of course, that it has a dog friendly patio  :)

UaXXoCDEMdvhKe91QoevzQ.text: The food and drinks are great but the service is HORRIBLE!   I feel like it's been recent but the waitresses and waiters DO NOT GIVE A **** about their job and the customers. As soon as you walk in to ask for a table you get blank stares, rude responses, the waitresses try to "pin" the customers on each other just to get crappy service the rest of the stay. They forget about you, and take forEVER to bring just extra menus.   I love them but wish they had better service/management. If you're looking for. A place for good and fast service you're better off somewhere else!

X021PmrxuAGNk-zXpAMyfQ.text: Their website advertised happy hour everyday from 3pm-7pm. However, we were told that does not include sunday. Sunday does have a happy hour that starts at 4pm.  We came here at 3 specifically for happy hour & were disappointed.  However, even though the price was too high ($11 for a cheese crisp), the service & product were good.

vsFwNyoKFQG34cSlNoST-A.text: I've been wanting to visit Sir Veza's Taco Garage for awhile -- any place with Mexican food and a patio is one that piques my interest. I was bummed about my experience there, though, and would recommend heading to BJ's nearby for much better service and atmosphere next time you're in the Chandler mall area and need a place to go to eat.  We were sat in a booth facing a sports television and lots of larger tables. The menus we received were dirty -- they had liquid and crumbs on them. Gross.  It took about 10 minutes after being sat for our hostess to bring us waters and chips. That was nice, but I really wanted to order a margarita, especially because we had a movie to get to and were on a bit of a time crunch. Several employees including a server walked by our table and looked directly at us, but there was no acknowledgement. Even a, "Hey, we just got slammed, but I'll be with you shortly" would have been great.  The chips were average, nothing to celebrate, but it's nice they're complimentary. The table set-up was a little odd -- each person gets a single fork and a rag that is supposed to be a napkin, but that looks like something the bussers use, too. I needed a fork for both my appetizer and my meal, so it's weird you don't just get one.  After about 15 minutes after being sat, a server came by to get our drink order. I had already gulped down all my water. From there, the meal was smooth sailing, but the dining experience was poorly managed to make two people wait 15 minutes to get a drink order going.  The strawberry margarita I did get was almost too surgary to drink. There wasn't a balance of flavors, and I quickly switched to beer.  The cheese quesadilla was huge and mighty tasty, thickly piled with cheese. Splitting half of it was enough to have a meal, along with the free chips.   I did order two vegetarian tacos and a side of refried beans and rice. I've never had Brussels sprouts on tacos and now want to try to re-create the recipe at home. That was an innovative taco topping, and one I give the restaurant kudos for. Several corn tortillas were used for each taco. They were sort of difficult to eat because of the awkward construction, but the taste was there.  While the food was decent, the ambiance was another negative aspect to this spot. I felt like the space wasn't used wisely -- between our booth and the tables, there was a large amount of space that just looked awkwardly set up. Maybe more tables or booths could have filled the random spots of big spaces in the restaurant.   The bathroom had a communal washbin area. Thankfully, the women's bathroom also had its own sinks, because I think it's really weird to be on display washing your hands all as a group outside the main bathrooms. But on the other hand, if you wash your hands in the women's bathroom and then skip the second communal station, it might seem like you never washed your hands. This is another example of the weird layout of the restaurant.  If you are in Chandler and want great Mexican food, go to Valle Luna, my favorite place. The service and ambiance are much better, and the food is much more memorable, too.

jVFns9xFNwdq651HNqCbvg.text: Awesome food, honestly, one of the best menues ever too...  JUST BE PREPARED TI WAIT 30-40 mins or more for your food!  Seriously, this place is busy it's painful!  looks like a bunch of 20 something slowmotion cooks in the kitchen... FIRE THE COOKS AND REHIRE SOME EXPERIENCED COOKS WHO CAN MoVE FAST!!! The fajitas were great, but some cheese and more rice would have been preferred. Nothing crazy amazing, but it did the job of filling me up.

xmsH060tg9RRg8v3F_Bprw.text: Trendy place. Service was good. Everything clean. I expected the tacos to be a bit bigger based on the price point. I'm happy I came in on a Tuesday and got them half off.

s1WI7oJLVO0e5RUcVbX2sw.text: Worst service ever! Ordered fries as an appetizer and it never came out. Food was bland, I've had better food for cheaper. This place is not worth its prize, will never be going back!

_i-TJ_1VjtEGS8uJ_qFjPA.text: Nice addition to all the food options at the Chandler Mall .. located next to the food court by the valet.  I've been to the 2 locations in Tucson also and they never disappoint..   On today's visit I had a jack & Coke with a generous pour.. yum! I then saw a michelada being fixed across the bar and I had to have one .. you need two hands too lift this baby off the bar .. they dunk the beer bottle in it and the rim has the lime spice .. tajin.. delish and very filling!!  For lunch I had two grilled fish tacos, with a side of rice & charro beans.. tasty.. I had the mamacita hot sauce for some kick.   The menu and happy hour menus have tons of great options .. the staff checks on you regularly.. good stuff!

0dVxge1fZvaemykzNYlRDg.text: We were so disappointed to show up to our favorite "Taco Tuesday" spot to find they closed the end of December! The sign on the door indicates something else will be coming to the space, but whatever it is, it can't compare to the delicious tacos served at Sir Veza's.   Miss ya!

1Yx8dJpPYfxBv3sxUyC9JA.text: You hear that siren?!  We got a quality weiner alert in the desert!  YesSir Veza's thank you for offering a Sonoran dog that I would actually recommend to out of towners.  And it's also a good place to watch all the televised games on college Fball Saturday or NFL Sundays!  What grabbed my attention always walking past the food court was their Sirnoran Hot Dog had a 100% angus all beef hot dog.  I shoved it down my pie hole and enjoyed every bite!  Oh of course there's the onion rings....beer battered but batter fell apart on a few so perhaps I would pass next time but they were A-OK.    Yes I know there are other places around town that serve the Sonoran Dog BUT well let's just say they all looked down at the floor when I ask about what kind of weiners they use!  Yea uh huh sure that's right go ahead and shove that craptastic junkified Oscar Mayer ding dong up your hoo hah where the sun don't shine!    There was a time when "Back in the Days when I was young I'm not a kid anymore but some days I wish I was a kid again" I could care less about what's in my hot diggity dog and would only focus on taste and flava only.  Welp the name Sirnoran Dog is well deserved cause I crushed it like a Sir, like a gentleman, like a boss yessirey indeedy!  I'll be back for HH specials!

Then the bartender finally came over took my order and then forgot to put it in . the food is good. And the portions are ample but the service was horrible. 3L77nyEeIFfKsMPptbYqxQ.text: I have to say I wasn't overly fond of their beer selection. I did like their guacamole. They make it at your table and there was lot, but that's not enough to go back for...

3m37eqoXZ7DbbMMUe9zHvQ.text: Our son just moved to Chandler and over Memorial Weekend our family of 6 decided to go here for dinner.  Were we surprised?? By far the best Mexican restaurant we have ever been too!! Our waiter Marcus was fantastic and the food was awesome!  We all tried something different and we all loved what we got. I ordered the chicken enchilada which was prepared a different way, that I loved!  You've got to order the guacamole because they come to the table to make it, so put everything in it, it's awesome!  Chips & Salsa are good too! We've been back 4 times in just a few short weeks. Can't say enough about this place. Loved it, loved it, loved it!

FI55DRZHemCDF8GTt-sGDw.text: Stumbled in here on a Thursday as I was leaving the mall, to my surprise found out every tequila is half priced..EVERY Thursday! The bartender Colby was super sweet and told me a ton about the background of some of the menu items and cocktails. Although I heard they are known for their gourmet street tacos I took a risk and ordered the Shrimp Stuffed Chile Rellano and man I'm sure happy I did! It had bacon, avocado, tomatoes, queso fresco and so much more goodness inside.  In addition to the classic sides of rice and beans they also included a zucchini and squash blend that was served in some sort of really taste sauce. I probably would of tried to squeeze in dessert if they're complimentary chips and salsa weren't so good! LOL  Also the Pink Paloma margarita is served with this grapefruit soda in a massive glass and I highly recommend trying one! Everything was great, I will certainly be back next Thursday to try the tacos...and more tequila.

u_QBcMWx8tXQsxy7tbsTHg.text: I had only 1 place in Arizona to really enjoy a chili relleno, it's 3 hours away. I found out today, I only need to drive 5 miles to get an even better relleno!! Also, if you like spicy, get a Cheech and Chong margarita, extra spicy, delicious!!! Martisse will take good care of you, as well as all the staff. Excellent experience!!! My new favorite!!!

bRRAe7UIa9LHQq7OAJoXUg.text: My new fave Mexican joint & I don't say this without several different dishes under my belt (pun intended). It figures this place is owned by the same family as the iconic El Charro in Tucson. Every dish from the tacos to the apple chimi is flavor filled & presented in awe inspiring splendor. My gal & I can recommend the SirNoran dog, the Diablo shrimp tacos, the fajitas (not your average)   Save room for dessert as the apple chimichanga is amazing & unique. The drink menu is just as creative & tasty as the food. The outdoor patio is great place to enjoy all this great fare. Ole

3WjC6BzoBB02hVtXaaJPmA.text: Loved the idea of a garage restaurant.  We stopped in for lunch after shopping for hours. r2LhpZ1b3pmjxYKVs6byXQ.text: This place is hit or miss... but when it's on, it's on. The shrimp diablo tacos are fantastic. The only thing lacking is the consistency with the food and service.   Love the bar and the tequila selection is pretty awesome.

NY81zZSpwB68QW5z0PDF2A.text: Cool casual place.  Great music. Decor is very well done. Prompt with the chips and salsa which were delicious. Excellent beer selection. We had the pork carnitas tacos and the grilled chicken tacos. Both were excellent.

DRR6Ya2k7ktXqkGequgWcg.text: Delicious burritos bowls and burgers, great drinks, Paleo and GF friendly! Well worth checking out.

1cbvEPSXWjxWrMmqRBkoCg.text: My wife and I tried this place before a movie. I ordered the taco salad with chicken. It was HUGE but the chicken was cubed and NOT fresh at all. I ACTUALLY hurt my tooth on one piece. You can tell they make the batch early and then let it sit. Out food came in like 4 minutes.... So if fresh quality food matters to you. I would skip it. Now I have 3 stars because the waitress did handle it well. She got the manager and it was taken off our bill. They offered to replace but I just wanted popcorn at that moment. So I was happy with how they dealt with it. Maybe I got unlucky? I usually NEVER say anything because I get embarrassed. but this was gross. I am sad. I thought we found a new spot. We tipped the waitress based on the original bill since she did a good job fixing thing. Not her fault they cut corners on the kitchen.

VP_0ANzkLfMEvj7jH5NaTA.text: My all time favorite place to go during happy hour or work meetings. The staff is wonderful and super friendly,  the food is delicious & the drinks are amazing. I am very picky about customer service and this place by far exceeds my expectations. The bartenders are incredible at their jobs & the servers are always on top of things. But If you want to get the best service always ask for Dee she's the best and will make your visit that much better :)

d9R0Y_CdwaZyvsN3NAIJiw.text: Tacos are good  atmosphere not so great  loud alternative rock music screaming too loud, should find something to play that all ages might enjoy! So loud, had a hard time talking with my date!

psBEWM4HIetXfrv9eQJOLw.text: Dee was an amazing hostess. Joe was a really good guy totally gave me the menu, let me know exactly what it is that they were serving. W0kCVAjQ0PfyjFVoXPQHaA.text: This restaurant was the worst Mexican food I have ever eaten.  My daughter ordered a beef taco and the beef looked like hamburger that look like it was cooked in a pan with no seasoning.  I tried a little bit of her ground beef and it was disgusting and dry.  Then the burrito I had was so dry I didn't eat 3/4 of it.  And my kids' meals were served on what appeared to be a school lunch tray.  All of our food was served cold.  This was a very big disappointment .

i0mqxtWfcXL1TjmBi28HIw.text: First off I love this place the food is amazing but the only reason we keeps coming back is because of Marcus! He gives the best service always gives us the best recommendation on food! If you ever stop into this place he's your sever to go too!

vc2uESNnKx4RvrmpBq25Aw.text: Not impressed. Not only did they bring me the wrong order but when it was corrected, new dish was cold. Very expensive and do not plan on coming back.

pUGmAKCbfQvOXpfHtR7VAw.text: Tasty drinks, good happy hour deals, upbeat atmosphere. Out of my handful of times eating here I've only had one issue with the food and the server said the head chef was out that night and "maybe the cooks are slacking" but that she'd talk to them. Nothing terrible, just carne asada and shrimp over cooked. Otherwise, every other time I've been there... on point!

PUhZyfXd7KiLFIX_rmnGqQ.text: I came to eat here when visiting my brother in Arizona. He swore this place had the best micheladas in Arizona so I for sure needed to try. It was a Friday afternoon around 4pm-5pm so it wasn't too packed yet. It was happy hour so they had 1/2 off appetizers and some discounted drinks which was good. We ordered a round of micheladas and let me tell you, my brother wasn't lying. They were good! When it came to the food, I ordered a appetizer. It was the Jalapeno Poppers (they had a different name and cant remember what it is). They were ok. Very crunchy which im not use to with jalapeno poppers and the cream cheese inside was very runny. I wouldn't get them again. For my meal I ordered the shrimp tacos (grilled shrimp not the Diablo shrimp) and it came with rice and beans. The rice and beans were not good. I'm Mexican so I guess you can say I have a high standard of what they should taste like and this wasn't it. Very generic almost tasted like they were canned. The rice was also not well cooked, kinda dry and crunchy. The shrimp tacos were good. The seasoning was good and the salsa it had was also very good. I would get them again but minus the rice and beans. All in all a great place for drinks but if you want Mexican food, definitely not the place for it.

BFZ-dVX9UcspBUIFNXLyLA.text: Awesome beer selection! Tons of rotating seasonals. The whole staff was great, especially our server, Denise. Ideal atmosphere to watch the fights.

zzqDi8aF8G9utPYdoHETGw.text: I've never written a yelp review but I feel this place needs to hear it as a former bartender and waitress I get sometimes you get busy but this was pure laziness.  I wanted to come for a celebration with family and friends and everything was HORRIBLE and made the night not what you want for celebrating. 1st the hostess with a huge attitude and extremely RUDE didn't have my reservation for 15 people but luckily there was plenty of space on the patio. After we finally got seated it took me after about 15-20 minutes of patiently waiting to get up and ask a sever if we could get service.        2 of the 3 people that chose to order food never got it because the order was never put in.  I had to constantly find our server to keep drinks full, remind them what they forgot or ask for it to be made how we ordered it,  at one point I ran my own drinks from the bar that sat there for a good 10 minutes while the "manager" was behind the bar just washing dishes. While I also watched my 2 servers standing by the POS stations ..       Lastly my bf and I sat down at the bar after everyone else left to have a drink together n couldn't get acknowledged yet alone service so we went over to BJS n got great friendly service..  Compltely ruined my experience and celebration. I've been here before and had bad service like this but just chalked it up to its a new place they need time, well this was the last time I or anyone of the 15 people who came to Sir Vezas last night will be back or spend our money there. I hope they find good help that cares and knows what they are doing..

39Da5gzM3fHPRUBRCEoZmg.text: Went for taco Tuesday. 50% off! Tacos were delicious and service was great. Definitely would return.

KLL6o8knF-sYTywZCcAzoA.text: Girlsfriends and I took a weekend trip to Phoenix, and came across this awesome place! The food was fresh and amazing. The customer service was above and beyond. Our waitress Layne, was one of the most honest and down to earth servers I've ever had. I would definitely recommend giving it a try.

6kqrWZk1cZIVjuJRnMHo-Q.text: Usually a great place to go but today, not so much. Had a bartender ignore me to spend her time making free drinks to an employee drinking beside me. The only redeeming part was the bartender helping me...She was awesome:

i5ORFHEa4FOMOFmfyOh0-Q.text: First off let me say I'm usually not one to give a bad review.... But this has to be said.  So I came with my family (mom,dad,sister etc.) It was our first time here. hnLuG-Pt8vyQFHZKksvZTQ.text: Love the food. I highly recommend the tacos. I usually get the diablo shrimp. Way overpriced. Almost worth it the money, but I like to splurge so I go here often.

A_NPPDk3zLDEKtGCe2nERw.text: I love this place! And the bartender Kendall is the bestest ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

cuAUuq0Tm2-hsyT8VpJOtw.text: Our first time here at Sir Veza's and we had a great experience. Our waitor Joe was friendly and helpful! He recommended the lunch special, different types of specials and spicy mango margarita! Everything was delicious! He was very thoughtful that he even packed our food to-go and iced cold water! We are definitely coming back for the food and great customer service.

_0mQY6eH3zW08nT1ANoTFA.text: This place is new in the dreaded location at the south main entrance to Chandler Fashion Square.  I say "dreaded" because every restaurant here has gone out of business for some reason even though the location is ideal for a restaurant.  I think Sir Veza's might be number 4 or 5 since 2001?  I'm not sure why the others failed.  But I digress!!!  The remodel looks great.  Very open with good TV viewing everywhere, and a nice indoor/outdoor seating arrangement.  The staff was Fantastic!  They truly acted like they wanted to be there.  Our server "Fire" was on fire with his service and attitude.  Really nice guy that cared about the place and the customers.  I ordered the 2 taco combo.  They were fantastic and nicely done.  They have an interesting approach to "glueing" two corn tortillas together with cheese to make a bigger taco.   Loved the chips and sides too (charro beans and rice).  Also you could get a "protein style" taco wrapped in lettuce for you low carb types.  I wish they put cheese in those though. (they didn't with my S.O.'s lettuce-wrap taco)  Fire mentioned that they also cater to gluten free people so that's great and unusual for a Mexican joint.  The margaritas were great too, btw!  The only down sides:    1.  I'd like to see a way to order tacos a la carte though so I could get more taco and no sides.   2.  The prices are high for the amount of food you get.  $12 for two tacos and beans and rice, and $15 for three tacos and beans and rice.  Ouch!   This could seriously stop many folks from coming back even though they love the food, IMO.  Suggestions: 1.  Add taco take-out at the food-court window.  You can only get hotdogs or something like that now.

OFu0r1k7C6EOuHtAO-uQQw.text: First timers from CA and we absolutely loved this place. Layne helped us and she was AMAZiNG!!

Hs4p69aciTQfKxsvaDHq3g.text: Chuck the bartender is amazing! Love his bartender ears and handmade sangria ;) and D the waitress is on point, not even our server and made sure we had anything we needed the entire time! 5 stars

zqIXoG4XnL0K8W4Wf_8J0A.text: My salad was very tasty. My husbands tacos were good but had very few veggies on it, mostly meat, which isn't what we prefer in a taco. Service was so-so.  The biggest complaint was the music was so loud we couldn't hear each other at all. And one of the waitress smelled heavily of alcohol. I MIGHT come back but my husband definitely would not.

Yw4AUBxVKw3l9bQyKPIbAg.text: Not a fan. The food is just not that great. The restaurant is pretty cool though, I'd definitely drink here!

Af_XXbhExQse7lDba4J32g.text: I have been to Sir Veza's two times now and I am only mildly impressed. The service has been pretty good but the food is just okay. My fiance has really enjoyed the burger's here but I have not liked either of the items I have tried. On our first visit I tried the Johnny Las Vegas roll which is kind of like a sushi style roll but it's not seafood. Instead it is a mixture of chicken, cream cheese, jalapeno, chipolte sauce and maybe a couple of other items thrown in all wrapped up in a chimichanga type of wrap. I did not care for this at all. It kind of tasted like chicken salad to me which I cannot stand. If you like chicken salad, you might like this, if you hate mushy texture, you will hate it.  I did also try the La Bomba soft pretzel with strips of poblano peppers and swiss cheese and served with nacho cheese dipping sauce and mustard, I did like this a lot. On our second visit which was on New Years day I tried the Sonoran Dog. I did not care for this either. For me the hot dog itself was way too salty. The beer battered fries are however delicious. On New Years day they also had a DJ at 7:30pm who was just bumping beats the entire time we were there. It seemed like he was trying to turn the place into a night club. The music selection was terrible, with rap songs melding into country. It was extremely off putting. My fiance and I could not carry a conversation because of the mini night club situation. The DJ was the only one dancing and was clearly enjoying himself very much.  If it were up to me I probably would not come back. My fiance does love the burger here so we will probably give it another shot. If we do come back I will try the tacos on the next visit. We will also probably come early in the day on a weekday. I'm not up for the rap/country/pop mash up night club.

osYXeZNaStAWsJTMm4MfOw.text: Being a Mexican snob, I was hesitant to come here. My mantra is "the dirtier the location, the better the food". From the moment I tried the salsa from the chips, I knew that this place was solid.   Shredded chicken burrito California style. Get that and you won't go wrong.

nvytZb7qslJhj-7YDwcOJQ.text: Cocktails were great, food and service were also great. Recommend the nachos with pork, but be prepared to share. Even the half order is gigantic. Only complaint would be it's incredibly loud inside, and they only have one fan on the patio, which is not enough for the Arizona heat.

Ey-oGZpK3eDftKl-Tb7GVQ.text: This place is AWESOME!! I'm never in this area but there are tons of options to go eat. Let me tell you this should be on your list. It's really cool (just like a mechanic shop) and the food is pretty good. I recommend

u5NYQfO6QhPtB-dYWVqLdQ.text: The atmosphere and decor are really nice and make for a fun place to eat.  I got the tacos; I never order tacos from anywhere. Felt like they were missing something, like a little spice, but were overall good. Also the brownie with ice cream was bomb!  Our server was very nice and quick to serve out table of 5, + 2 kids. Even better is the fact that they have groupons, which we used.  I will most likely be back and plan to try something different.

UnKf9UKyIunrlRiPlJsMnA.text: *** So sad. They changed the menu and now the Nivana taco is made with Brussel sprouts and fajita mix which I can not eat .  I can't even express how sad this makes me   I didn't think it was possible but they got even better with updates menu I'm loving the Nirvana vegetarian tacos. Wonderful!  I've had them two days in a row   David provided awesome service!  He's our regular guy .   Excellent food and service !  All seasonings are gluten free.  Burro bowl not just filled with rice like some places. I had the shredded chicken.  I tasted shredded beef and really good not fatty.  They have $8 lunch and 1/2 off taco Tuesday   Dog friendly patio  Large outside space. I bet it's really busy at night as they have happy hour and really fun atmosphere   I'll be back for sure

iPNRRwZ1qAiry70pbCyccQ.text: I love Sir Veza's! The staff are very friendly and attentive. When you order food, it always comes out quickly. The happy hour menu is awesome! The drink and food specials during happy hour are reasonably priced and happen everyday from 3-7. Margaritas are strong and flavorful. Tacos are huge and can easily be split among two people. A+++!

rNp6tHjYsXqxHKw82btwNA.text: Omg please get the Diablo shrimp tacos. They are life changing. Hahaha.   Honestly though the food is awesome, and the waitstaff are all knowledgable, with a great list of recommendations from the menu. The tacos are AMAZING. I was hungry so I ordered three and should've only gotten two. They are amazing flavors and expertly made. :)  Definitely check them out!

fAzxkpcYXv_y-vJlCZIURA.text: BEST tacos. Grilled chicken is the way to go. We always go here for taco Tuesday. Tacos are half off and the service is great and the food always comes out so fast. I literally won't go to any other tacos spot. I just wish it wasn't at the chandler mall but that's the only down fall. Try this place out

EUObfiPASjn1D7DcLUZYLQ.text: This place doesn't even deserve one star. After sitting at our table with no offer for a drink while we wait, we decided to get up and leave and go spend our money at BJ's across the way. Thanks for nothing!

jkgx0hTzjAimSIryuC4ahw.text: We were out shopping at the mall and decided to stop in here for an early dinner. We came during happy hour, so of course my hubby had to try a margarita! It was a blackberry margarita and it was very tasty (I had more than one sip lol)   My daughter ordered the kids burger which was decent, and my hubby and I shared the nachos. They were HUGE! Plenty of food for two people to share as a meal. The nachos were very good, but not the best I have ever had.  The best part of our meal was our server, De. She was super friendly, knowledgeable, engaging, and speedy! All the things I like in a good server.   We will definitely go back again!

3Xz1qGS7kgV_b2jFzJ3mGw.text: The worst tacos they should be called second hand tacos! I was on a short lunch break and told the waitress I wanted two tacos to go. She insisted on putting in an order for a meal stating that it was cheaper (I doubt it). I asked for light onions and instead they gave me light cilantro and what looks like extra onions. Before eating I thought about returning it and getting what I asked for but had too much difficulty and decided to try them out. Omg let's just say these greasy Carne Asada tacos taste more like a breakfast sausage! I would return them but my pride is too big and I wouldn't dare want the little waitress to think it was about the price since I inquired about single tacos vs a meal:(

rEi094RMUrJ_epSd8ABs6A.text: Great service. I had a carne asada bowl and a margarita (forgot name). A must order. Got my food in less then 10 minutes after ordering. Again great fresh food and fairly inexpensive. If you're in chandler this place is a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Chandler, AZ, United States. Carne Asada bowl and margarita.

rDFWu9K7TJ2t6x5M8LT5Eg.text: This restaurant is the best "garage" ever!   Most of the staff is incredibly friendly and welcome you as you walk past.   Decor is all moto... Shop rags for napkins, wheels for the base to booths, drop-light lighting, wrench chandelier, truck and motorcycle parts on the walls & ceilings, side mirror collage over sink basin, and the list goes on.  So very creative.     Big screen TVs everywhere for the sports fans.    The food is a mixed lot.   First visit we ordered nachos... Thankfully only one order as they serve a HUGE amount.  (Seriously 1/4 sheet cake piled high). We chose the pork with prickly pear salsa and the meat was melt in your mouth perfection.     Second visit I had the best hamburger that I've eaten in years.   No bun, but they do offer Gluten Free buns. Woohoo! Drag strip chicken was pretty good, dredged in corn flour, no wheat!!  Hubby had chimi, again like the nachos, the portion is HUGE.  ( good for a big dude )  The fries were undercooked and a little cold, but have potential.     They were out of their "special" (cannot remember what it was that day).  Good thing they have plenty to choose from.   And GLUTEN FREE options.  Which is good for those of is with intolerance or mild allergies.   I hope they are successful and stay!!!

4-iWF8FJkghQwWeiOn3T5A.text: My first instinct was to discount this place based on its cheesy name, but the lure of a Groupon brought me in. And oh my goodness, it was delicious!   I tried 3 tacos (the beef with zucchini was my favorite), and my lady got the SirNoran dog. Holy cow, what a hot dog! We will definitely be back!

x6GVhVS_JMIu2rtgBxg_rA.text: I was extremely disappointed when I arrived at the garage today. I went to order the Prickly Pear BBQ tacos that I am in love with...only to find out that they don't have them anymore.  My server, Bobby, went up and above the call of duty to get the kitchen to make them for me. I will definitely be back because of him! He's also super hot, so that's a plus!!

s-JzgHgR25OADejKppwfOQ.text: I had 2 Tacos... Beef and Chicken. Beef was ok... But the chicken and avocado combo really was amazing. Presentation and the decor is interesting.... Built like a garage as the name suggests. Music is fun and funky. Good place to hang out....

Unpady_hYpskPdB9Gkhi2g.text: I absolutely love the Diablo shrimp tacos from here, I mean seriously I crave them. Anyway my wife and I came by yesterday for a lunch date and both ordered 3 tacos, she ordered Nana's chicken, carnitas and carne asada tacos. The Nanas chicken taco was amazing, the other 2 were good as well, but the chicken was far and away her favorite. I ordered the Diablo shrimp, the vegetarian taco, and the chicken club taco. The Diablo shrimp was super delicious as always, sweet and spicy, with shrimp that are crispy on the outside and perfectly cooked on the inside. The vegetarian taco was actually a bit of a surprise in how good it actually was. Super fresh tasting, with an awesome garlicky cream sauce and crispy fried avocado it's going to become a regularly ordered item for me. The chicken club however was just blah to be honest, nothing bad about it, it just didn't impress the way the other two tacos did. We really enjoyed our food, but as others have said, the service was definitely lacking. It took our server 15 mins AFTER we had gotten our margaritas to offer us water as well, and she didn't check in after we had gotten our food, she was no where to be found when we were ready for the check, and it really wasn't busy...we were one of 5 families at the restaurant. But otherwise the food was great as usual!

3bPgsLVwl7FtdSFmEyQF3Q.text: Happy Customer.  I had the Sonoran Dog with beer battered onion strings. Both were good.  The other item is a burrito with shaker style very big and very filling.  Margaritas as well.
